analyzed: sarva tathāgata tattva saṅgrah
translated: The compendium of the truth of all the Tathagatas.

original: evaṃ mayā śru tamekasmin samaye bhagavān sarvatathāgatavajrādhiṣṭhānasamayajñānavividhaviśeṣasamanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: evam mayā śru tam ekasmin samaye bhagavān sarva tathāgata vajra adhiṣṭhāna samaya jñāna vividha viśeṣa samanvāgataḥ
translated: Thus have I heard at one time the Blessed One, endowed with the knowledge of the pledge of all the Vajras of all the Tathagatas, possessing various special qualities,

analyzed: sarva tathāgata ratna mukuṭa traidhātuka dharma rājya abhiṣeka prāptaḥ
translated: having attained the consecration of the Dharma kingdom of the three realms with the jeweled crown of all the Tathagatas,
the great yogic lord of all knowledge of all the Tathagatas,
having attained the equality of all the seals of all the Tathagatas, accomplishing all actions, fulfilling the wishes of the entire realm of sentient beings without exception,

analyzed: mahā kṛpaḥ vairocanaḥ śāśvataḥ tri adhva samaya vyavasthitaḥ sarva kāya vāc citta vajraḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: the eternal Vairocana, the Tathagata of great compassion, abiding in the pledge of the three times, the Vajra of all bodies, speech, and minds,

analyzed: sarva tathāgata adhyuṣita praśasta stavite mahā maṇi ratna pratyupte vicitra varṇa ghaṇṭā avasakta māruta uddhata paṭṭa sraj cāmara hāra ardhahāra candra upaśobhite akaniṣṭha devarājasya bhavane vijahāra
translated: dwelt in the palace of the king of the Akanishtha gods, which was praised and inhabited by all the Tathagatas, adorned with great jeweled ornaments, with various colored bells, with banners, garlands, yak-tail fans, necklaces, half-necklaces, and moons swaying in the wind,

analyzed: nava navatibhiḥ bodhisattva koṭibhiḥ sārdham
translated: together with nine koṭis of Bodhisattvas.

analyzed: tat yathā vajrapāṇinā ca bodhisattvena
translated: Namely, with the Bodhisattva Vajrapani,

analyzed: avalokiteśvareṇa ca bodhisattvena
translated: Avalokiteśvara, the Bodhisattva,

analyzed: ākāśa garbheṇa ca
translated: Ākāśagarbha,

analyzed: vajramuṣṭinā ca
translated: Vajramuṣṭi,

analyzed: mañjuśriyā ca
translated: Mañjuśrī,

analyzed: saha citta utpāda dharma cakra pravartinā ca
translated: Sahācittotpādadharmacakrapravartin,

analyzed: gagana gañjena ca sarva māra bala pramardinā ca
translated: Gagana­gañja, and Sarvamārabala­pramardi,

analyzed: evaṃpramukhaiḥ nava navatibhiḥ bodhisattva koṭibhiḥ
translated: and with nine hundred and ninety million other Bodhisattvas,

analyzed: gaṅgā nadī vālukā samākhyātaiḥ ca tathāgataiḥ
translated: and with Tathāgatas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: tadyathāpi nāma tilabimbamiva paripūrṇaṃ jambūdvīpe saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma tila bimbam iva paripūrṇam jambūdvīpe saṃdṛśyate
translated: Just as a sesame pod is seen to be filled with Jambūdvīpa,

analyzed: taiḥ ca aprameyaiḥ tathāgataiḥ ekaikasmāt ca tathāgata kāyāt aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni buddhakṣetrāṇi saṃdṛśyante
translated: and from each Tathāgata's body immeasurable and countless Buddha-fields are seen,

original: teṣu ca buddhakṣetreṣu imameva dharmanayaṃ deśayanti sma /
analyzed: teṣu ca buddhakṣetreṣu imam eva dharma nayam deśayanti sma
translated: and in those Buddha-fields this very Dharma method is being taught.

original: atha bhagavān mahāvairocanaḥ sarvākāśadhātusadāvasthitakāyavākcittavajraḥ sarvatathāgatasamavasaraṇatayā sarvavajradhātvavabodhanajñānasattvaḥ sarvākāśadhātuparamāṇurajo vajrādhiṣṭhānasambhavajñānagarbhaḥ sarvatathāgatānantatayā mahavajrajñānābhiṣekaratnaḥ sarvākāśaspharaṇatathatājñānābhisambodhyabhisambodhibhūtaḥ sarvatathāgatātmabhāvaśuddhitayāsvabhāvaśuddhasarvadharmaḥ sarvākāśacaryāgryaḥ sarvatathāgatāmoghājñākāritayā sarvāsamānuttaraviśvakarmā /
analyzed: atha bhagavān mahāvairocanaḥ sarva ākāśa dhātu sadā avasthita kāya vāc citta vajraḥ sarva tathāgata samavasaraṇa tayā sarva vajra dhātu avabodhana jñāna sattvaḥ sarva ākāśa dhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ vajra adhiṣṭhāna sambhava jñāna garbhaḥ sarva tathāgata ananta tayā maha vajra jñāna abhiṣeka ratnaḥ sarva ākāśa spharaṇa tathatā jñāna abhisambodhi abhisambodhi bhūtaḥ sarva tathāgata ātma bhāva śuddhitayā svabhāva śuddha sarva dharmaḥ sarva ākā
translated: Then the Blessed One, Mahāvairocana, whose body, speech, and mind always abide in all the realms of space, who is the being of knowledge that awakens to all the vajra realms through being the convergence of all tathāgatas, who is the womb of knowledge that arises from the blessing of all the atoms in all the realms of space, who is the jewel of the great consecration of vajra knowledge through being infinite like all tathāgatas, who is the essence of perfect enlightenment through the knowledge of suchness that pervades all space, who is the pure self-nature of all dharmas through the purity of the body of all tathāgatas, who is the foremost conduct in all the realms of space, who is the all-accomplishing action that is unequaled and unsurpassed through performing the infallible command of all tathāgatas,

original: sarvatathāgatamahābodhidṛḍhasattvaḥ sarvatathāgatakarṣaṇasamayaḥ sarvatathāgatānurāgaṇajñāneśvaraḥ sarvatathāgatasādhukāraḥ sarvatathāgatamahābhiṣekaratnaḥ sarvatathāgatasūryaprabhāmaṇḍalaḥ sarvatathāgatacintārājamaṇiratnaketuḥ sarvatathāgatamahāhāsaḥ sarvatathāgatamahāśuddhadharmaḥ sarvatathāgataprajñājñānaḥ sarvatathāgatacakraḥ sarvatathāgatamahāvīryasudṛḍhakavacaḥ sarvatathāgatarakṣaparipālanavajrayakṣaḥ sarvatathāgatakāyavākcittavajrabandhamudrājñānaḥ Eulogy of Samantabhadra the mahabodhistattva
analyzed: sarva tathāgata mahā bodhi dṛḍha sattvaḥ sarva tathāgata karṣaṇa samayaḥ sarva tathāgata anurāgaṇa jñāna īśvaraḥ sarva tathāgata sādhukāraḥ sarva tathāgata mahā abhiṣeka ratnaḥ sarva tathāgata sūrya prabhā maṇḍalaḥ sarva tathāgata cintārāja maṇi ratna ketuḥ sarva tathāgata mahā hāsaḥ sarva tathāgata mahā śuddha dharmaḥ sarva tathāgata prajñā jñānaḥ sarva tathāgata cakraḥ sarva tathāgata mahā vīrya su dṛḍha kavacaḥ sarva tathā
translated: The firm being of the great enlightenment of all Tathagatas, the binding rule of all Tathagatas, the lord of the knowledge of delighting all Tathagatas, the approval of all Tathagatas, the jewel of the great consecration of all Tathagatas, the orb of the sun-like radiance of all Tathagatas, the jewel-crested wish-fulfilling gem of all Tathagatas, the great laughter of all Tathagatas, the great pure Dharma of all Tathagatas, the wisdom-knowledge of all Tathagatas, the wheel of all Tathagatas, the great armor of firm valor of all Tathagatas, the adamantine Yaksha who protects and guards all Tathagatas, the knowledge of the seal that binds the vajra body, speech, and mind of all Tathagatas.
The great being Samantabhadra, the successful Mara, the leader of joy,

analyzed: kha garbhaḥ su mahā tejāḥ ratnaketuḥ mahā smitaḥ
translated: The one with the sky womb, of great splendor, the jewel-crested one with a great smile,

analyzed: avalokita mahā īśaḥ ca mañjuśrīḥ sarva maṇḍalaḥ
translated: Avalokita, Mahesha, Manjushri, the one with all mandalas,

analyzed: avācaḥ viśvakarmā ca vīryaḥ caṇḍaḥ dṛḍhagrahaḥ
translated: The one without speech, the creator of all, the one with great effort, the fierce one, the one with firm grasp,

original: vajro'ṅ kuśaḥ śarastuṣṭiḥ ratnaḥ sūryo dhvajaḥ smitaḥ /
analyzed: vajra ūṅ kuśaḥ śaraḥ tuṣṭiḥ ratnaḥ sūryaḥ dhvajaḥ smitaḥ
translated: Vajra, Ankuśa, Śara, Tuṣṭi, Ratna, Sūrya, Dhvaja, Smita,

original: padmaḥ kośaḥ sucakro vāk karma varma ravayo grahaḥ // //
analyzed: padmaḥ kośaḥ su cakraḥ vāc karma varma ravayaḥ grahaḥ
translated: Padma, Kośa, Sucakra, Vāk, Karma, Varman, Ravaya, Graha,

analyzed: an ādi nidhanaḥ śāntaḥ rudraḥ krodhaḥ mahā kṣamaḥ
translated: Without beginning or end, peaceful, Rudra, anger, greatly forgiving,

analyzed: yakṣaḥ su rākṣasaḥ dhīraḥ sauriḥ sauriḥ mahā vibhuḥ
translated: Yakṣa, demon, wise, son of the sun, son of the sun, greatly powerful,

analyzed: umāpatiḥ prajānāthaḥ viṣṇuḥ jiṣṇuḥ mahā muniḥ
translated: Lord of Umā, protector of beings, Viṣṇu, conqueror, great sage,
Protector of the world, sky, earth, the three worlds, the three realms,
Great element, of good essence, all, Śarva, the grandfather,

analyzed: saṃsāraḥ nirvṛtiḥ śaśvat samyak vṛttiḥ mahā mahaḥ
translated: The world, always complete, right conduct, great festival,

analyzed: buddhaḥ śuddhaḥ mahāyānaḥ tri bhavaḥ śāśvataḥ hisaḥ
translated: Buddha, pure, of the great vehicle, the three worlds, he is eternal,
The conqueror of the three worlds, Śambhu, the lord of Śambhu, the giver,
The lord of the vajra, the best of good lands, knowledge, the way of the perfections,

analyzed: vimokṣaḥ bodhisattvaḥ ca caryaḥ sarva tathāgataḥ
translated: Liberation, the bodhisattva, practice, all tathāgatas,

analyzed: buddha arthaḥ buddha hṛdayaḥ sarva bodhiḥ anuttaraḥ
translated: The meaning of Buddha, the heart of Buddha, all enlightenment, unsurpassed,

analyzed: vairocanaḥ jinaḥ nāthaḥ svayaṃbhūḥ dhāraṇī smṛtiḥ
translated: Vairocana, the victor, the lord, the self-existent, the dhāraṇī, the mindfulness,
The great being, the great seal, the samadhi, the one who performs the deeds of the Buddha,

analyzed: sarva buddha ātmakaḥ bhūtaḥ sattvaḥ nitya artha bodhakaḥ
translated: The essence of all Buddhas, the being who teaches the meaning of permanence,

analyzed: mahā sthāṇuḥ mahākālaḥ mahā rāgaḥ mahā sukhaḥ
translated: The great pillar, the great time, the great passion, the great bliss,
The great sin, the foremost of the great, the foremost of all, the lord of the world,

original: bhagavān mahābodhicittaḥ samantabhadro mahābodhisattvaḥ sarvatathāgatahṛdayeṣu vijahāra /
analyzed: bhagavān mahā bodhi cittaḥ samantabhadraḥ mahā bodhisattvaḥ sarva tathāgata hṛdayeṣu vijahāra
translated: The Blessed One, the great enlightened mind, the all-good great bodhisattva, dwelt in the hearts of all tathagatas.

original: atha sarvatathāgatairidaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ tadyathā tilabimbamiva paripūrṇama //
analyzed: atha sarva tathāgataiḥ idam buddhakṣetram tat yathā tila bimbam iva paripūrṇam
translated: Then this buddha-field was filled by all the tathagatas, as if with sesame seeds.

analyzed: atha khalu sarva tathāgatāḥ mahā samājam āpadya
translated: Then indeed all the tathagatas assembled.

analyzed: yena sarvārthasiddhiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bodhimaṇḍa niṣaṇṇaḥ tena upajagmuḥ
translated: They approached the bodhisattva mahasattva Sarvarthasiddhi who was seated at the seat of enlightenment.

original: upetya bodhisattvasya sāṃbhogikaiḥ kāyairdarśanandatvaivamāhuḥkathaṃ kulaputrānuttarāṃ samyaksambodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: upetya bodhisattvasya sāṃbhogikaiḥ kāyaiḥ darśanan datvā evam āhuḥ katham kula putra anuttarām samyaksambodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: Having approached, they showed the bodhisattva their sambhogakaya forms and said, How, O son of noble family, will you attain supreme perfect enlightenment?

analyzed: yaḥ tvam sarva tathāgata tattva anabhijña tayā sarva duḥkarāṇi utsahasi ti
translated: Since you do not know the truth of all tathagatas, you are undertaking all difficulties.

analyzed: atha sarvārthasiddhiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ sarva tathāgata coditaḥ samānaḥ tatas āsphāna samādhitaḥ vyutthāya
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Sarvarthasiddhi, urged by all the Tathagatas, arose from the Akashamudraya Samadhi.

original: sarvatathāgatān praṇipatyāhū yaivamāhabhagavantastathāgatā ājñāpayata kathaṃ pratipadyāmi kīdṛśaṃ tat tattvam iti /
analyzed: sarva tathāgatān praṇipatya āhū yā evam āha bhagavantaḥ tathāgatāḥ ājñāpayata katham pratipadyāmi kīdṛśam tat tattvam iti
translated: Having bowed to all the Tathagatas, he said, The Blessed Tathagatas command me. How should I proceed? What is that reality like?

original: evamukte sarvatathāgatāstaṃ bodhisattvamekakaṇṭhenaivamāhuḥpratipadyasva kulaputra svacittapratyavekṣaṇasamādhānena prakṛtisiddhena rucijaptena mantreṇa iti oṃ cittaprativedhaṃ karomi /
analyzed: evam ukte sarva tathāgatāḥ tam bodhisattvam eka kaṇṭhena evam āhuḥ pratipadyasva kula putra sva citta pratyavekṣaṇa samādhānena prakṛti siddhena ruci japtena mantreṇa iti om citta prativedham karomi
translated: When this was said, all the Tathagatas spoke with one voice to that Bodhisattva, saying, Proceed, O son of noble family, with the samadhi of examining your own mind, with the naturally accomplished mantra that is to be recited as desired. Om, I penetrate the mind.

original: atha bodhisattvaḥ sarvatathāgatānevamāhaājñātaṃ me bhagavantastathāgatāḥ svahṛdi candramaṇḍalākāraṃ paśyāmi /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ sarva tathāgatān evam āha ājñātam me bhagavantaḥ tathāgatāḥ sva hṛdi candra maṇḍala ākāram paśyāmi
translated: Then the Bodhisattva said to all the Tathagatas, I have understood, O Blessed Tathagatas. I see in my heart the form of a moon mandala.

analyzed: sarva tathāgatāḥ procuḥ prakṛti prabhāsvaram idam kula putra cittam
translated: All the Tathagatas said, O son of noble family, this mind is naturally luminous.

analyzed: tat yathā parikarṣyate tat tathā eva bhavati
translated: As it is drawn, so it becomes.

analyzed: tat yathā api nāma śveta vastre rāga rañjanam iti
translated: For example, like dyeing a white cloth.

original: atha sarvatathāgatāḥ prakṛtiprabhāsvaracittajñānasya sphītīkaraṇahetoḥ punarapi tasmai bodhisattvāya oṃ bodhicittamutpādayāmi ityanena prakṛtisiddhena mantreṇa bodhicittamutpāditavantaḥ /
analyzed: atha sarva tathāgatāḥ prakṛti prabhāsvara citta jñānasya sphītīkaraṇa hetoḥ punar api tasmai bodhisattvāya om bodhi cittam utpādayāmi iti anena prakṛti siddhena mantreṇa bodhi cittam utpāditavantaḥ
translated: Then, in order to increase the knowledge of the naturally radiant mind, all the Tathagatas again generated the enlightenment mind in that Bodhisattva with the naturally accomplished mantra, Om, I generate the enlightenment mind.

original: atha bodhisattvaḥ punarapi sarvatathāgatājñayā bodhicittamutpādyaivamāhayat taccandramaṇḍalākāraṃ taccandramaṇḍalameva paśyāmi /
analyzed: atha bodhisattvaḥ punar api sarva tathāgata ājñayā bodhi cittam utpādya evam āhayat tat candra maṇḍala ākāram tat candra maṇḍalam eva paśyāmi
translated: Then, the Bodhisattva, having again generated the enlightenment mind by the command of all the Tathagatas, said this: I see that moon-shaped [form] as just the moon-disk.

analyzed: sarva tathāgatāḥ āhuḥ sarva tathāgata hṛdaya ante samanta bhadraḥ citta utpādaḥ sāmīcībhūtaḥ
translated: All the Tathagatas said, The heart of all Tathagatas, the mind generation of Samantabhadra, has been properly inclined.

analyzed: tat sādhu pratipadyatām
translated: Therefore, practice well.

original: sarvatathāgatasamantabhadracittotpādasya dṛḍhīkaraṇahetoḥ svahṛdi candramaṇḍale vajrabimbaṃ cintayānena mantreṇa oṃ tiṣṭha vajra /
analyzed: sarva tathāgata samantabhadra citta utpādasya dṛḍhīkaraṇa hetoḥ sva hṛdi candra maṇḍale vajra bimbam cintayānena mantreṇa om tiṣṭha vajra
translated: For the sake of solidifying the generation of the mind of Samantabhadra of all Tathagatas, visualize a vajra-image on a moon-disk in your heart with this mantra: Om, remain vajra.

analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ āha paśyāmi bhagavantaḥ tathāgatāḥ candra maṇḍale vajram
translated: The Bodhisattva said, Blessed Ones, Tathagatas, I see the vajra on the moon-disk.

analyzed: sarva tathāgatāḥ āhuḥ dṛḍhīkuru idam sarva tathāgata samanta bhadra citta vajram anena mantreṇa om vajra ātmakā ūham
translated: All the Tathagatas said, “Make this firm, the mind of all the Tathagatas, Samantabhadra, with this mantra: ‘Om, I am of the nature of Vajra.’“

analyzed: atha yāvantaḥ sarva ākāśa dhātu samavasaraṇāḥ sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta vajra dhātavaḥ
translated: Then, as many as are contained in the entire realm of space, the Vajra Realms of Body, Speech, and Mind of all the Tathagatas,

original: te sarve sarvatathāgatādhiṣṭhānena tasmin sattvavajre praviṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: te sarve sarva tathāgata adhiṣṭhānena tasmin sattva vajre praviṣṭāḥ
translated: all of them, by the empowerment of all the Tathagatas, entered that Vajra Being.

original: tataḥ sarvatathāgataiḥ sa bhagavān sarvārthasiddhirmahābodhisattvo vajradhāturvajradhāturiti vajranāmābhiṣekeṇābhiṣiktaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sarva tathāgataiḥ sa bhagavān sarvārthasiddhiḥ mahā bodhisattvaḥ vajradhātuḥ vajradhātuḥ iti vajra nāma abhiṣekeṇa abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, Sarvarthasiddhi, the Great Bodhisattva, was consecrated by all the Tathagatas with the Vajra Name Consecration, as Vajradhatu.

original: atha vajradhāturmahābodhisattvastān sarvatathāgatānevamāha paśyāmi bhagavantastathāgatāḥ sarvatathāgatakāyamātmānam /
analyzed: atha vajradhātuḥ mahā bodhisattvaḥ tān sarva tathāgatān evam āha paśyāmi bhagavantaḥ tathāgatāḥ sarva tathāgata kāyam ātmānam
translated: Then the Great Bodhisattva Vajradhatu said this to all the Tathagatas: “I see myself, Blessed Tathagatas, as the Body of all the Tathagatas.”

original: sarvatathāgatāḥ prāhuḥtena hi mahāsattva sattvavajraṃ sarvākāravaropetaṃ buddhabimbamātmānaṃ bhāvayānena prakṛtisiddhena mantreṇa rucitaḥ parijapya oṃ yathā sarvatathāgatāstathāham //
analyzed: sarva tathāgatāḥ prāhuḥ tena hi mahāsattva sattva vajram sarva ākāra vara upetam buddha bimbam ātmānam bhāvayānena prakṛti siddhena mantreṇa rucitaḥ parijapya om yathā sarva tathāgatāḥ tathā aham
translated: All the Tathagatas said, “Then, Great Being, contemplate yourself as the Vajra Being, the form of a Buddha endowed with all the supreme aspects, with this naturally accomplished mantra, which you should recite as much as you like: ‘Om, just as all the Tathagatas, so am I.’”

analyzed: atha evam ukte vajradhātuḥ mahā bodhisattvaḥ tathāgatam ātmānam abhisambudhya
translated: Then, when this was said, the great Bodhisattva Vajradhātu, having realized the Tathāgata in himself,

original: tān sarvatathāgatān praṇipatyāhū yaivamāha adhitiṣṭhata māṃ bhagavantastathāgatā imāmabhisaṃbodhiṃ dṛḍhīkuruta ceti /
analyzed: tān sarva tathāgatān praṇipatya āhū yā evam āha adhitiṣṭhata mām bhagavantaḥ tathāgatāḥ imām abhisaṃbodhim dṛḍhīkuruta ca iti
translated: having bowed to all the Tathāgatas, said this: May the Blessed Tathāgatas consecrate me, and may they confirm this realization of mine.

original: athaivamukte sarvatathāgatā vajradhātostathāgatasya tasmin sattvavajre praviṣṭā iti //
analyzed: atha evam ukte sarva tathāgatāḥ vajradhātoḥ tathāgatasya tasmin sattva vajre praviṣṭāḥ iti
translated: Then, when this was said, all the Tathāgatas entered the Vajrasattva of the Tathāgata Vajradhātu.

original: atha bhagavān vajradhātustathāgatastasmin eva kṣaṇe sarvatathāgatasamatājñānābhisaṃbuddha sarvatathāgatavajrasamatājñānamudrāguhyasamayapraviṣṭaḥ sarvatathāgatadharmasamatājñānādhigamasvabhāvaśuddhaḥ sarvatathāgatasarvasamatāprakṛtiprabhāsvarajñānākarabhūtastathāgato'rhān samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ saṃvṛtta iti //
analyzed: atha bhagavān vajradhātuḥ tathāgataḥ tasmin eva kṣaṇe sarva tathāgata samatā jñāna abhisaṃbuddha sarva tathāgata vajra samatā jñāna mudrā guhya samaya praviṣṭaḥ sarva tathāgata dharma samatā jñāna adhigama svabhāva śuddhaḥ sarva tathāgata sarva samatā prakṛti prabhāsvara jñāna ākara bhūtaḥ tathāgataḥ ūrhān samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ iti
translated: Then, at that very moment, the Blessed Tathāgata Vajradhātu, having realized the knowledge of equality of all Tathāgatas, having entered the secret pledge of the knowledge-seal of the vajra-equality of all Tathāgatas, having attained the nature of purity, the knowledge of the equality of all dharmas of all Tathāgatas, having become the source of the knowledge of the natural luminosity of the equality of all things of all Tathāgatas, he became the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: atha sarvatathāgatāḥ punarapi tataḥ sarvatathāgatasattvavajrān niḥsṛtyākāśagarbhamahāmaṇiratnābhiṣekeṇābhiṣicyāvalokiteśvaradharmajñānamutpādya sarvatathāgataviśvakarmatāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena sumerugirimūrdhā yena ca vajramaṇiratnaśikharakūṭāgārastenopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: atha sarva tathāgatāḥ punar api tatas sarva tathāgata sattva vajrāt niḥsṛtya ākāśagarbha mahā maṇi ratna abhiṣekeṇa abhiṣicya avalokita īśvara dharma jñānam utpādya sarva tathāgata viśva karma tāyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena sumeru giri mūrdhā yena ca vajra maṇi ratna śikhara kūṭāgāraḥ tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Then all the Tathagatas again emerged from those Vajra Beings of all the Tathagatas, and consecrated them with the great jewel consecration of the womb of space, generated the Dharma knowledge of Avalokitesvara, and established them in the state of all the Tathagatas' universal activity, and they approached the peak of Mount Sumeru and the palace of the vajra jewel peak.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya vajradhātum tathāgatam sarva tathāgata tve dhiṣṭhya
translated: Having approached, they consecrated the Tathagata Vajradhatu in the state of all the Tathagatas.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata siṃhāsane sarvatomukham pratiṣṭhāpayāmāsuḥ iti
translated: They established him facing all directions on the lion throne of all the Tathagatas.

original: Emanation of the deities from samadhi
analyzed: emanation of the deitiya from samadhi
translated: Emanation of the Deities from Samadhi

original: atha khalu akṣobhyastathāgato ratnasaṃbhavaśca tathāgato lokeśvararājaśca tathāgato amoghasiddhiśca tathāgataḥ sarvatathāgatatvaṃ svayamātmanyadhiṣṭhāya /
analyzed: atha khalu akṣobhyaḥ tathāgataḥ ratnasaṃbhavaḥ ca tathāgataḥ lokeśvara rājaḥ ca tathāgataḥ amoghasiddhiḥ ca tathāgataḥ sarva tathāgata tvam svayam ātmani adhiṣṭhāya
translated: Then indeed the Tathagata Akshobhya, the Tathagata Ratnasambhava, the Tathagata Lokeswara-raja, and the Tathagata Amoghasiddhi, having consecrated themselves in the state of all the Tathagatas,

analyzed: bhagavataḥ śākyamuneḥ tathāgatasya sarva samatā su prativedha tvāt sarva diś samatām abhyālambya
translated: by the Bhagavat Shakyamuni's Tathagata's thorough penetration of all equalities, relying on the equality of all directions,

analyzed: catasṛṣu dikṣu niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: they sat in the four directions.

analyzed: vajrasattva
translated: Vajrasattva

original: atha bhagavān vairocanastathāgataḥ acirābhisaṃbuddhaḥ sarvatathāgatasamantabhadrahṛdayasarvatathāgatākāśasaṃbhavamahāmaṇiratnābhiṣekābhiṣiktaḥ sarvatathāgatāvalokiteśvaradharmajñānaparamapāramitāprāptaḥ sarvatathāgataviśvakarmatāmoghāpratihataśāsanaḥ paripūrṇakāryaḥ paripūrṇamanorathaḥ sarvatathāgatatvaṃ svayamātmanyadhiṣṭhāya /
analyzed: atha bhagavān vairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ acira abhisaṃbuddhaḥ sarva tathāgata samanta bhadra hṛdaya sarva tathāgata ākāśa saṃbhava mahā maṇi ratna abhiṣeka abhiṣiktaḥ sarva tathāgata avalokita īśvara dharma jñāna parama pāramitā prāptaḥ sarva tathāgata viśva karmatā mogha a pratihata śāsanaḥ paripūrṇa kāryaḥ paripūrṇa manorathaḥ sarva tathāgata tvam svayam ātmani adhiṣṭhāya
translated: Then the Blessed One, Vairocana, the Tathagata, who had attained enlightenment not long before, who had been consecrated with the great jewel of the sky of all Tathagatas, who had attained the supreme perfection of the knowledge of the Dharma of all Tathagatas, Avalokiteshvara, who had accomplished all the activities of all Tathagatas, whose command was infallible and unimpeded, whose work was complete, whose wishes were fulfilled, having consecrated the state of all Tathagatas in himself,

original: sarvatathāgatasamantabhadramahābodhisattvasamayasambhavasattvādhiṣṭhānavajraṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpadyedaṃ sarvatathāgatamahāyānābhisamayaṃ nāma sarvatathāgatahṛdayaṃ svahṛdayāna niścacāra vajrasattva //
analyzed: sarva tathāgata samantabhadra mahā bodhisattva samaya sambhava sattva adhiṣṭhāna vajram nāma samādhim samāpadya idam sarva tathāgata mahāyāna abhisamayam nāma sarva tathāgata hṛdayam sva hṛdayāna niścacāra vajra sattva
translated: entered the samadhi called Vajra arising from the essence of all Tathagatas, the pledge of the great Bodhisattva Samantabhadra, the basis of the essence of beings, and brought forth from his heart this essence of all Tathagatas called The Great Vehicle of All Tathagatas: Vajrasattva.

original: athāsmin viniḥsṛtamātre sarvathāgatahṛdayebhyaḥ sa eva bhagavāṃ samantabhadraścandramaṇḍalāni bhūtvā viniḥsṛtya /
analyzed: atha asmin viniḥsṛta mātre sarvathāgata hṛdayebhyaḥ saḥ eva bhagavām samanta bhadraḥ candra maṇḍalāni bhūtvā viniḥsṛtya
translated: Then, as soon as this essence of all Tathagatas had been brought forth, from the hearts of all Tathagatas, the Blessed One himself, Samantabhadra, having become moon-discs, came forth,

analyzed: sarva sattvānām mahā bodhi cittāni saṃśodhya
translated: Having purified the great enlightenment mind of all sentient beings,

analyzed: sarva tathāgatānām sarva pārśveṣu avasthitāḥ
translated: they remained on all sides of all the Tathagatas.

analyzed: atha tebhyaḥ candra maṇḍalebhyaḥ sarva tathāgata jñāna vajrāṇi viniḥsṛtya
translated: Then from those moon-discs, all the Vajra Knowledge of the Tathagatas emerged,

analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya tathāgatasya hṛdaye praviṣṭāni
translated: and entered the heart of the Blessed Tathagata Vairocana.

original: samantabhadratvācca sudṛḍhatvācca vajrasattvasamādheḥ sarvatathāgatādhiṣṭhānena caikadhanaḥ sakalākāśadhātusamavasaraṇapramāṇo raśmimālo pañcamūrdhā sarvatathāgatakāyavākcittavajramayovajravigrahaḥ prādurbhūya /
analyzed: samanta bhadra tvāt ca su dṛḍha tvāt ca vajra sattva samādheḥ sarva tathāgata adhiṣṭhānena ca eka dhanaḥ sakala ākāśa dhātu samavasaraṇa pramāṇaḥ raśmimālo pañcamūrdhā sarva tathāgata kāya vāc citta vajra mayaḥ vajra vigrahaḥ prādurbhūya
translated: And by the firmness of the Vajra-Being-Whole-Enlightenment, and by the consecration of all the Tathagatas, they became one whole, the size of all the realm of space, with a garland of light-rays, with five heads, made of the Vajra Body, Speech, and Mind of all the Tathagatas, and appeared in the form of a Vajra.

original: sarvathāgatahṛdayān niṣkramya pāṇau pratiṣṭhitaḥ /🔽atha tato vajrād vajrākārā raśmayo vicitravarṇarūpāḥ sarvalokadhātvābhāsanaspharaṇā viniścaritāḥ /
analyzed: sarvathāgata hṛdayāt niṣkramya pāṇau pratiṣṭhitaḥ  atha tatas vajrāt vajra ākārāḥ raśmayaḥ vicitra varṇa rūpāḥ sarva lokadhātu ābhāsana spharaṇāḥ viniścaritāḥ
translated: Having emerged from the heart of all the Tathagatas, he remained in the hand (of the Principal One).🔽Then from that Vajra there emerged light-rays in the form of Vajras, of various colors and forms, illuminating and pervading all the world systems.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca vajraraśmi mukhebhyaḥ sarva lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ tathāgata vigrahāḥ viniḥsṛtya
translated: And from those light-ray mouths of Vajras, Tathagata-forms equal to the dust-motes of all world systems emerged,

analyzed: sakala dharmadhātu samavasaraṇeṣu sarva ākāśa dhātu paryavasāneṣu sarva lokadhātu prasara megha samudreṣu sarva tathāgata samatā jñāna abhijñāsu abhisaṃbodhāt
translated: from the realization of the knowledge of the equality of all tathāgatas in the clouds and oceans of all world systems that extend throughout the entire realm of space, which are included in the entire realm of phenomena.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata mahā bodhi citta utpādana samanta bhadra vividha caryā niṣpādana sarva tathāgata kula ārāgaṇa mahā bodhi maṇḍa upasaṃkramaṇa sarva māra dharṣaṇa sarva tathāgata samatā mahā bodhi abhisaṃbudhyana dharma cakra pravartanam yāvat aśeṣa anavaśeṣa sattvadhātu paritrāṇa sarva hita sukha sarva tathāgata jñāna abhijñā uttama siddhi niṣpādana ādīni sarva tathāgata vikurvitāni sandarśya
translated: Having manifested all the magical displays of the tathāgatas, such as generating the great enlightenment mind of all tathāgatas, accomplishing the various practices of Samantabhadra, pleasing all the tathāgata families, approaching the great seat of enlightenment, overpowering all māras, attaining the great enlightenment of the equality of all tathāgatas, turning the wheel of the Dharma, and so forth, up to delivering and benefiting all sentient beings without exception, and accomplishing the supreme attainments of the knowledge and higher knowledge of all tathāgatas,

analyzed: samantabhadra tvāt vajra sattva samādheḥ su dṛḍha tvāt ca eka ghanaḥ samantabhadra mahā bodhisattvakāyaḥ saṃbhūya
translated: he became the single, solid body of the great bodhisattva Samantabhadra, from the firmness of the vajra-sattva samādhi of Samantabhadra.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye sthitvā idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: Having arisen, he remained in the heart of the Blessed One Vairocana and uttered this udāna:

analyzed: aho samanta bhadroham dṛḍha sattvaḥ svayaṃbhuvām
translated: Oh! I am Samantabhadra, the firm being of the self-arisen ones,

analyzed: yat dṛḍha tvāt akāyaḥ api sattva kāya tvam āgataḥ
translated: By whose firmness, though bodiless, I have come to have the body of beings.

analyzed: atha samantabhadra mahā bodhisattva kāyaḥ bhagavataḥ hṛdayāt avatīrya
translated: Then the body of the great bodhisattva Samantabhadra descended from the heart of the Blessed One.

analyzed: sarva tathāgatānām puratas candra maṇḍala āśritaḥ bhūtvā ājñām mārgayāmāsa
translated: And having taken his place on a moon-disc in front of all the tathagatas, he requested instructions.

original: atha bhagavān sarvatathāgatajñānasamayavajraṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpadya /
analyzed: atha bhagavān sarva tathāgata jñāna samaya vajram nāma samādhim samāpadya
translated: Then the Blessed One entered the samadhi called The Adamantine Time of the Knowledge of All Tathagatas,

analyzed: sarva tathāgata śīla samādhi prajñā vimukti vimukti jñāna darśana dharma cakra pravartana sattva artha mahā upāya bala vīrya mahā jñāna samayam aśeṣa anavaśeṣa sattvadhātu paritrāṇa sarva ādhipatya sarva sukha saumanasya anubhavana artha yāvat sarva tathāgata samatā jñāna abhijñā anuttara mahāyāna abhisamaya uttama siddhi avāpti phala
translated: and in order to benefit beings by turning the wheel of Dharma of morality, samadhi, wisdom, liberation, and the vision of liberation, and in order to accomplish the great knowledge of skillful means, strength, and energy, and in order to protect the entire realm of beings without exception, and in order to experience all sovereignty and all happiness and joy, up to the attainment of the supreme accomplishment of the unsurpassed great vehicle of the knowledge and higher knowledge of equality of all tathagatas,

original: hetostatsarvatathāgatasiddhivajraṃ tasmai samantabhadrāya mahābodhisattvāya sarvatathāgatacakravartitve sarvabuddhakāyaratnamukuṭapaṭṭābhiṣekeṇābhiṣicya pāṇibhyāmanuprādāt /
analyzed: hetoḥ tat sarva tathāgata siddhi vajram tasmai samantabhadrāya mahā bodhisattvāya sarva tathāgata cakravarti tve sarva buddha kāya ratna mukuṭa paṭṭa abhiṣekeṇa abhiṣicya pāṇibhyām anuprādāt
translated: The cause, the vajra of the accomplishment of all the Tathāgatas, he conferred upon the great Bodhisattva Samantabhadra, and consecrated him with the consecration of the jewel crown of the body of all the Buddhas in the state of the universal emperor of the wheel of all the Tathāgatas, and bestowed it upon him with his hands.

analyzed: tatas sarva tathāgataiḥ vajrapāṇiḥ vajrapāṇiḥ iti vajra nāma abhiṣekeṇa abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: Then all the Tathāgatas consecrated Vajrapāṇi with the consecration of the name Vajrapāṇi.

original: atha vajrapāṇirbodhisattvo mahāsattvo vāmavajragarvollālanatayā tadavajraṃ svahṛdyutkarṣaṇayogena dhārayannidamudānamudānayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vāma vajra garva ullālana tayā tat avajram sva hṛdi utkarṣaṇa yogena dhārayan idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, the great being, holding that vajra in the manner of holding to one's heart through the playfulness of the pride of the left vajra, uttered this udāna:

analyzed: idam tat sarva buddhānām siddhi vajram anuttaram
translated: This is the unsurpassed vajra of the accomplishment of all the Buddhas,

original: ahaṃ mama kare dattaṃ vajraṃ vajre pratiṣṭhitam // iti //
analyzed: aham mama kare dattam vajram vajre pratiṣṭhitam iti
translated: the vajra given to me in my hand, established in the vajra.

analyzed: vajra raja
translated: Vajraraja

original: atha bhagavān punarapyamogharājamahābodhisattvasamayasaṃbhavasattvādhiṣṭhānavajraṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpadyadaṃ sarvatathāgatākarṣaṇasamayannāma sarvatathāgatahṛdayaṃ svahṛdayānniścacāra vajrarāja //
analyzed: atha bhagavān punar api amogharāja mahā bodhisattva samaya saṃbhava sattva adhiṣṭhāna vajram nāma samādhim samāpadi adam sarva tathāgata ākarṣaṇa samayat nāma sarva tathāgata hṛdayam sva hṛdayāt niścacāra vajrarāja
translated: Then the Blessed One, having again entered the samadhi called Vajra-womb of the Being born from the Samaya of the Great Bodhisattva Amogharaaja, brought forth from his heart the essence mantra of all Tathagatas called the Samaya of the Attraction of all Tathagatas: Vajraraja.

original: athāsmin viniḥsṛtamātre sarvatathāgatahṛdayebhyaḥ sa eva bhagavān vajrapāṇi sarvatathāgatamahāṅkuśāni bhūtvā viniḥsṛtya /
analyzed: atha asmin viniḥsṛta mātre sarva tathāgata hṛdayebhyaḥ saḥ eva bhagavān vajrapāṇi sarva tathāgata mahā aṅkuśāni bhūtvā viniḥsṛtya
translated: Then, as soon as this heart of all the Tathagatas had been uttered, the Blessed One himself, Vajrapani, having become the great goads of all the Tathagatas, emerged,

original: bhagavato vairocanasya hṛdaye praviṣṭvaikaghano vajrāṅku śamahāvigrahaḥ prādurbhūya /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye praviṣṭvā eka ghanaḥ vajra aṅku śa mahā vigrahaḥ prādurbhūya
translated: and having entered the heart of the Blessed One Vairocana, he became the great form of the Vajra Goad, solid and one, and appeared.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ pāṇau pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: He took his place in the Blessed One's hand.

analyzed: atha tatas vajrāṅku śa mahā vigrahāt sarva lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ tathāgata vigrahāḥ viniḥsṛtya
translated: Then from that great form of the Vajra Goad there emerged Tathagata forms equal to the dust-motes of all world systems,

analyzed: sarva tathāgata karṣaṇa ādīni sarva buddha ṛddhi vikurvitāni kṛtvā
translated: and having performed all the deeds of a Buddha, such as drawing in all the Tathagatas, and all the miracles and marvelous deeds of the Buddhas,

analyzed: sva mogha rāja tvāt vajra sattva samādheḥ su dṛḍha tvāt ca eka ghanaḥ amogha rāja mahā bodhisattvakāyaḥ saṃbhūya
translated: because of being the king of all wiles, and because of the extreme firmness of the concentration of Vajrasattva, he became the one solid form of the great Bodhisattva Amogharaaja,

analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye sthitvā idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: and having taken his place in the heart of the Blessed One Vairocana, he uttered this udana:

analyzed: aho hi amogha rājā aham vajra saṃbhavam aṅku śaḥ
translated: Ah! I am indeed the Amogharaaja, the Vajra-born goad,

analyzed: yat sarva vyāpinaḥ buddhāḥ samākṛṣyanti siddhayaḥ iti
translated: by which all the all-pervading Buddhas are drawn in and accomplished!

analyzed: atha saḥ umogha rāja mahā bodhisattva kāyaḥ bhagavataḥ hṛdayāt avatīrya
translated: Then that body of the great bodhisattva Amogharaaja descended from the heart of the Blessed One,

analyzed: sarva tathāgatānām dakṣiṇa candra maṇḍala āśritaḥ bhūtvā
translated: and stood in the moon disc to the right of all the Tathagatas,

analyzed: punar api ājñām mārgayāmāsa
translated: and again requested the consecration.

analyzed: atha bhagavān sarva tathāgata ākarṣaṇa samaya vajrat nāma samādhim samāpadya
translated: Then the Blessed One, entering the samadhi called Vajra of the Rule of Summoning All Tathagatas,

original: sarvatathāgatākarṣaṇasamayamaśeṣānavaśeṣasattvadhātusarvākarṣaṇasarvasukhasaumanasyānubhavanārthaṃ yāvat sarvatathāgatasamājādhiṣṭhānottamasiddhyarthaṃ tadvajrāṅkuśaṃ tasmai amogharājāya mahābodhisattvāya tathaiva pāṇibhyāmanuprādāt /
analyzed: sarva tathāgata ākarṣaṇa samayam aśeṣa anavaśeṣa sattvadhātu sarva ākarṣaṇa sarva sukha saumanasya anubhavana artham yāvat sarva tathāgata samāja adhiṣṭhāna uttama siddhi artham tat vajrāṅkuśam tasmai amogharājāya mahā bodhisattvāya tathā eva pāṇibhyām anuprādāt
translated: in order to summon all beings without exception by the rule of summoning all Tathagatas, for the sake of experiencing all happiness and well-being, up to the supreme accomplishment of the consecration of the assembly of all Tathagatas, he bestowed that vajra hook on that great bodhisattva Amogharaaja, placing it in his hands as before.

analyzed: tatas sarva tathāgataiḥ vajrākarṣaḥ vajrākarṣaḥ iti vajra nāma abhiṣekeṇa abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: Then all the Tathagatas consecrated him with the consecration of the name Vajra, calling him Vajra Hook, Vajra Hook.

analyzed: atha vajrākarṣaḥ bodhisattvaḥ tena vajrāṅkuśena sarva tathāgatān ākarṣayan idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vajra Hook, summoning all the Tathagatas with that vajra hook, expressed this udana:

analyzed: idam tat sarva buddhānām vajra jñānam anuttaram
translated: This is the unsurpassed vajra knowledge of all the Buddhas,

analyzed: yat sarva buddha artha siddhi artha samākarṣaṇam uttamam iti  vajra raga
translated: Which is the supreme summoning for the sake of accomplishing all the aims of the Buddhas.

original: atha bhagavān punarapi māramahābodhisattvasamayasaṃbhavasattvādhiṣṭhānavajraṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpadyedaṃ sarvatathāgatānurāgaṇasamayannāma sarvatathāgatahṛdayaṃ svahṛdayānniścacāra vajrarāga //
analyzed: atha bhagavān punar api māra mahā bodhisattva samaya saṃbhava sattva adhiṣṭhāna vajram nāma samādhim samāpadya idam sarva tathāgata anurāgaṇa samaya nāma sarva tathāgata hṛdayam sva hṛdayāt niścacāra vajrarāga
translated: Then the Blessed One, having again entered the samadhi called Vajra Passion, the consecration of the being of the Samaya of the Great Bodhisattva Passion, brought forth from his vajra heart this heart of all Tathagatas called Passion of all Tathagatas: Vajra Passion.

original: athāsmin viniḥsṛtamātre sarvatathāgatahṛdayebhyaḥ sa eva bhagavān vajradharaḥ sarvatathāgatakusumāyudhāni bhūtvā viniḥsṛtya /

analyzed: atha bhagavān punar api mañjuśrī mahā bodhisattva samaya saṃbhava dharma adhiṣṭhāna vajram nāma samādhim samāpadi adam sarva tathāgata mahā prajñā jñāna samayat nāma sarva tathāgata hṛdayam sva hṛdayāt niścacāra vajratīkṣṇa
translated: Then the Blessed One again entered the samadhi called Vajra-empowerment of the Dharma arising from the pledge of the great Bodhisattva Manjushri, and brought forth from his heart the essence mantra of all Tathagatas called Great Wisdom Knowledge Pledge of all Tathagatas: Vajra-sharp.

original: athāsmin viniḥsṛtamātre sarvatathāgatahṛdayebhyaḥ sa eva bhagavān vajradharaḥ prajñāśastrāṇi bhūtvā viniḥsṛtya /
analyzed: atha asmin viniḥsṛta mātre sarva tathāgata hṛdayebhyaḥ saḥ eva bhagavān vajra dharaḥ prajñā śastrāṇi bhūtvā viniḥsṛtya
translated: As soon as this essence mantra of all Tathagatas came forth, from the hearts of all Tathagatas, the Blessed One Vajra-Holder himself, in the form of wisdom weapons, came forth.

original: bhagavato vairocanasya hṛdaye praviṣṭvaikadhano vajrakośavigrahaḥ prādurbhūya /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye praviṣṭvā ekadhanaḥ vajra kośa vigrahaḥ prādurbhūya
translated: Having come forth, he entered the heart of the Blessed One Vairocana, and becoming one, he appeared in the form of Vajra-coffer.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ pāṇau pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: He was established in the Blessed One's hand.

analyzed: atha tatas vajrakośa vigrahāt sarva lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ tathāgata vigrahāḥ viniścaritvā
translated: Then from that form of Vajra-coffer, Tathagata forms equal to the atoms of all world realms came forth,

analyzed: sarva tathāgata prajñā jñāna ādīni sarva buddha ṛddhi vikurvitāni kṛtvā
translated: and having performed all the Tathagata's acts such as showing the wisdom knowledge of all Tathagatas,

analyzed: su mañjuśriya tvāt vajra sattva samādheḥ su dṛḍha tvāt ca eka ghanaḥ mañjuśrī mahā bodhisattvakāyaḥ saṃbhūya
translated: due to being well-known as Manjushri, and due to the firmness of the vajra-being samadhi, they combined into one, becoming the form of the great Bodhisattva Manjushri.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye sthitvā idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: Having arisen, he entered the heart of the Blessed One Vairocana and uttered this udāna:

analyzed: aho hi sarva buddhānām mañjughoṣam aham smṛtaḥ
translated: Ah! I am indeed the Mañjughoṣa of all the Buddhas,

analyzed: yat prajñāyāḥ arūpiṇyāḥ ghoṣa tvam upalabhyate
translated: By whose formless wisdom, sound is perceived.

analyzed: atha sa mañjuśrī mahā bodhisattva kāyaḥ bhagavataḥ hṛdayāt avatīrya
translated: Then that body of the great Bodhisattva Mañjuśrī, having descended from the heart of the Blessed One,

analyzed: sarva tathāgatānām dakṣiṇa candra maṇḍala āśritaḥ bhūtvā
translated: remained in the southern lunar disc of all the Tathāgatas,

analyzed: punar api ājñām mārgayāmāsa
translated: and again requested the command.

original: atha bhagavān sarvatathāgataprajñājñānavajraṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpadya /
analyzed: atha bhagavān sarva tathāgata prajñā jñāna vajram nāma samādhim samāpadya
translated: Then the Blessed One, having entered the samādhi called The Vajra Knowledge of the Wisdom of All Tathāgatas,

analyzed: sarva tathāgata kleśa chedana samayam aśeṣa anavaśeṣa sattvadhātu sarva duḥkha chedana
translated: for the sake of cutting off the afflictions of all Tathāgatas, for the sake of cutting off the suffering of all the realms of sentient beings without exception,

original: sarvasukhasaumanasyānubhavanārthaṃ yāvat sarvatathāgataghoṣānugaprajñāpārirpūryuttamasiddhyarthaṃ tasmai mañjuśriye mahābodhisattvāya tadvajrakośaṃ tathaiva pāṇibhyāmanuprādāt /
analyzed: sarva sukha saumanasya anubhavana artham yāvat sarva tathāgata ghoṣa anuga prajñā pārirpūrī uttama siddhi artham tasmai mañjuśriye mahā bodhisattvāya tat vajra kośam tathā eva pāṇibhyām anuprādāt
translated: for the sake of experiencing all happiness and joy, up to the sake of the supreme accomplishment of the perfection of wisdom that accords with the voice of all Tathāgatas, he bestowed that vajra treasury upon that Mañjuśrī, the great Bodhisattva, in his hands just as it was.

analyzed: tatas sarva tathāgataiḥ vajrabuddhiḥ vajrabuddhiḥ iti vajra nāma abhiṣekeṇa abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: Then all the Tathagatas consecrated him with the consecration of the name of Vajra, saying: 'Vajra Wisdom, Vajra Wisdom!'

original: atha sa vajrabuddhirbodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ tena vajrakośena sarvatathāgatān praharannidamudānamudānayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha sa vajrabuddhiḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tena vajra kośena sarva tathāgatān praharan idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Vajra Wisdom, the Great Being, striking all the Tathagatas with that vajra-sword, uttered this udana:

analyzed: idam tat sarva buddhānām prajñāpāramitā nayam
translated: This is the method of the perfection of wisdom of all the Buddhas,

analyzed: chettāram sarva śatrūṇām sarva pāpa haram param iti
translated: The supreme cutter of all enemies, the remover of all evil.

analyzed: vajra hetu
translated: Vajra Cause

original: atha bhagavān punarapi sahacittotpāditadharmacakrapravartimahābodhisattvasamayasaṃbhavadharmādhiṣṭhānavajraṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpadyedaṃ sarvatathāgatacakrasamayannāma sarvatathāgatahṛdayaṃ svahṛdayānniścacāra vajrahetu //
analyzed: atha bhagavān punar api saha citta utpādita dharmacakra pravarti mahā bodhisattva samaya saṃbhava dharma adhiṣṭhāna vajram nāma samādhim samāpadya idam sarva tathāgata cakra samayat nāma sarva tathāgata hṛdayam sva hṛdayāt niścacāra vajra hetu
translated: Then the Blessed One, having again entered the samadhi called The Vajra Basis of the Dharma Arisen from the Samaya of the Great Bodhisattva who Turns the Wheel of the Dharma upon the Generation of Mind, brought forth from his heart this essence of all Tathagatas called The Samaya of the Wheel of All Tathagatas: Vajrahetu.

original: athāsmin viniḥsṛtamātre sarvatathāgatahṛdayebhyaḥ sa eva bhagavān vajradharo vajradhātumahāmaṇḍalādīni sarvatathāgatamaṇḍalāni bhūtvā viniḥsṛtya /
analyzed: atha asmin viniḥsṛta mātre sarva tathāgata hṛdayebhyaḥ saḥ eva bhagavān vajradharaḥ vajra dhātu mahā maṇḍala ādīni sarva tathāgata maṇḍalāni bhūtvā viniḥsṛtya
translated: Then, as soon as this essence of all Tathagatas had been brought forth, the Blessed One, Vajradhara himself, having become all the maṇḍalas of all Tathagatas, such as the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm, and so forth, emerged from the hearts of all the Tathagatas.

original: bhagavato vairocanasya hṛdaye praviṣṭvaikaghano vajracakravigrahaḥ prādurbhūya /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye praviṣṭvā eka ghanaḥ vajra cakra vigrahaḥ prādurbhūya
translated: and entered into the heart of the Blessed One Vairocana. Having entered, he became a single vajra wheel form, and emerged from the heart of the Blessed One.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ pāṇau pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: He was established in the Blessed One's hand.

original: atha tato vajracakravigrahāt sarvalokadhātuparamāṇurajaḥsamāḥ tathāgatavigrahā viniścaritvā /
analyzed: atha tatas vajra cakra vigrahāt sarva lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ tathāgata vigrahāḥ viniścaritvā
translated: Then from that vajra wheel form, Tathāgata forms equal to the dust-motes of all world systems emerged.

analyzed: saha citta utpāda dharma cakra pravartana ādīni sarva buddha ṛddhi vikurvitāni sarva lokadhātuṣu kṛtvā
translated: Having performed all the miracles and transformations of all the Buddhas in all world systems, such as turning the wheel of the Dharma upon the arising of the thought of enlightenment,

analyzed: saha citta utpāda dharmacakra pravartana tvāt vajra sattva samādheḥ su dṛḍha tvāt ca eka ghanaḥ saha citta utpādita dharmacakra pravarti mahā bodhisattva kāyaḥ saṃbhūya
translated: and due to the turning of the wheel of the Dharma upon the arising of the thought of enlightenment, and due to the firmness of the vajra-mind concentration, he became a single mass, the form of the great Bodhisattva Turning the Wheel of the Dharma upon the Arising of the Thought of Enlightenment.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye sthitvā idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: Having emerged, he was established in the heart of the Blessed One Vairocana and uttered this udāna:

analyzed: aho vajra mayam cakram aham vajra agra dharmiṇām
translated: Ah! This vajra wheel is mine, of those who have the supreme vajra dharma,

analyzed: yat citta utpāda mātreṇa dharmacakram pravartate
translated: By which the wheel of the Dharma turns merely by the arising of the thought of enlightenment.

analyzed: atha sa saha citta utpādita dharma cakra pravarti mahā bodhisattva kāyaḥ bhagavataḥ hṛdayāt avatīrya
translated: Then that form of the great Bodhisattva Turning the Wheel of the Dharma upon the Arising of the Thought of Enlightenment emerged from the heart of the Blessed One.

analyzed: sarva tathāgatānām vāma candra maṇḍala āśritaḥ bhūtvā
translated: He sat on the left moon-disc of all the Tathagatas,

analyzed: punar api ājñām mārgayāmāsa
translated: and again requested the Command.

analyzed: atha bhagavān sarva tathāgata cakra vajrat nāma samādhim samāpadya
translated: Then the Blessed One, having entered the samadhi called Vajra Wheel of All Tathagatas,

original: sarvatathāgatamahāmaṇḍalasamayaṃ śeṣānavaśeṣasattvadhātupraveśāvaivartikacakrasarvasukhasaumanasyānubhavanārthaṃ yāvat sarvatathāgatasaddharmacakrapravartanottamasiddhinimittaṃ tadvajracakraṃ tasmai sahacittotpāditadharmacakrapravartine mahābodhisattvāya tathaiva pāṇibhyāmanuprādāt /
analyzed: sarva tathāgata mahā maṇḍala samayam śeṣa anavaśeṣa sattvadhātu praveśa a vaivartika cakra sarva sukha saumanasya anubhavana artham yāvat sarva tathāgata saddharma cakra pravartana uttama siddhi nimittam tat vajra cakram tasmai saha citta utpādita dharma cakra pravartine mahā bodhisattvāya tathā eva pāṇibhyām anuprādāt
translated: for the sake of experiencing all the happiness and joy of all the Tathagatas' great mandalas, the irreversible wheel of entering the realms of all beings without exception, and for the sake of the supreme accomplishment of turning the wheel of the true Dharma of all Tathagatas, he gave that vajra wheel to that great Bodhisattva who had turned the wheel of Dharma as soon as the thought arose, into his hands.

analyzed: tatas sarva tathāgataiḥ vajramaṇḍaḥ vajramaṇḍaḥ iti vajra nāma abhiṣekeṇa abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: Then all the Tathagatas consecrated him with the vajra consecration, calling him Vajramandala, Vajramandala.

original: atha vajramaṇḍo bodhisattvo sahāsattvastena vajracakreṇa sarvatathāgatānavaivartikatve pratiṣṭhāpayannidamudānamudānayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha vajramaṇḍaḥ bodhisattvaḥ sahāsattvaḥ tena vajra cakreṇa sarva tathāgatān avaivartika tve pratiṣṭhāpayan idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Vajramandala, together with the assembly, having established all the Tathagatas in irreversibility with that vajra wheel, uttered this udana:

analyzed: idam tat sarva buddhānām sarva dharma viśodhakam
translated: This is the purifier of all the Dharmas of all the Buddhas,

analyzed: a vaivartika cakram tu bodhimaṇḍam iti smṛtam iti  vajra bhasa
translated: The irreversible wheel is known as the seat of enlightenment.

original: atha bhagavānavācamahābodhisattvasamayasaṃbhavadharmādhiṣṭhānavajrannāma samādhiṃ samāpadyedaṃ sarvatathāgatajāpasamayaṃ nāma sarvatathāgatahṛdayaṃ svahṛdayānniścacāra vajrabhāṣa //
analyzed: atha bhagavān avāca mahā bodhisattva samaya saṃbhava dharma adhiṣṭhāna vajrat nāma samādhim samāpadya idam sarva tathāgata jāpa samayam nāma sarva tathāgata hṛdayam sva hṛdayāt niścacāra vajrabhāṣa
translated: Then the Blessed One, having entered the samadhi called Vajra Speech, the consecration of the Dharma of the assembly of the great Bodhisattva Vajra Speech, brought forth from his heart this essence mantra of all Tathagatas called The Seal of Recitation of All Tathagatas: Vajra Bhasa.

original: athāsmin viniḥsṛtamātre sarvatathāgatahṛdayebhyaḥ sa eva bhagavān vajrapāṇiḥ sarvatathāgatadharmākṣarāṇi bhūtvā viniḥ sṛtya /
analyzed: atha asmin viniḥsṛta mātre sarva tathāgata hṛdayebhyaḥ saḥ eva bhagavān vajrapāṇiḥ sarva tathāgata dharma akṣarāṇi bhūtvā viniḥ sṛtya
translated: Then, as soon as this essence mantra of all Tathagatas came forth, the Blessed One Vajrapani himself, becoming the syllables of the Dharma of all Tathagatas, came forth.

original: bhagavato vairocanasya hṛdaye praviṣṭvaikadhano vajrajāpavigrahaḥ prādurbhūya /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye praviṣṭvā ekadhanaḥ vajra jāpa vigrahaḥ prādurbhūya
translated: Having entered the heart of the Blessed One Vairocana, becoming a single entity, he appeared in the form of Vajra Recitation.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ pāṇau pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: He was established in the Blessed One's hand.

analyzed: atha tatas vajra jāpa vigrahāt sarva lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ tathāgata vigrahāḥ viniḥsṛtya
translated: Then from that form of Vajra Recitation, Tathagata forms equal to the dust particles of all world systems came forth.

original: sarvatathāgatadharmatādini sarvabuddharddhivikurvitāni kṛtvā svavācatvād vajrasattvasamādheḥ sudṛḍhatvāccaikaghanaḥ avācamahābodhisattvakāyaḥ
analyzed: sarva tathāgata dharmatā ādini sarva buddha ṛddhi vikurvitāni kṛtvā sva vāca tvāt vajra sattva samādheḥ su dṛḍha tvāt ca eka ghanaḥ avāca mahā bodhisattva kāyaḥ
translated: Having performed all the miracles and transformations of all the Buddhas, etc., by the firmness of the Vajrasattva concentration, which is his own speech, he became the great Bodhisattva form of Ava-ca,

analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye sthitvā idam udānayāmāsa
translated: and, standing in the heart of the Blessed One Vairocana, he uttered this udana:

analyzed: aho svayaṃbhuvām guhyam sandhā bhāṣam aham smṛtaḥ
translated: Ah! The secret of the Self-Existent Ones, I am remembered as the symbolic speech,

analyzed: yat deśayanti saddharmam vāc prapañca vivarjitam
translated: By which they teach the true Dharma, free from the proliferation of speech.

analyzed: atha sa avāca mahā bodhisattva kāyaḥ bhagavataḥ hṛdayāt avatīrya
translated: Then that great Bodhisattva form of Ava-ca descended from the heart of the Blessed One,

analyzed: sarva tathāgatānām pṛṣṭhatas candra maṇḍala āśritaḥ bhūtvā
translated: and, standing on a moon-disc behind all the Tathagatas,

analyzed: punar api ājñām mārgayāmāsa
translated: he again requested the Command.

original: atha bhagavān sarvatathāgataguhyavāgvajraṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpadya /
analyzed: atha bhagavān sarva tathāgata guhya vāc vajram nāma samādhim samāpadya
translated: Then the Blessed One, having entered the concentration called Vajra Speech of the Secret of all the Tathagatas,

original: sarvatathāgatavāgjñānasamayaṃ aśeṣānavaśeṣasattvadhātuvāksiddhisarvasukhasaumanasyānubhavanārthaṃ yāvatsarvatathāgatavāgguhyatāprāptyuttamasiddhaye tadvajrajāpaṃ tasmai avācāya mahābodhisattvāya tathaiva pāṇibhyāmanuprādāt /
analyzed: sarva tathāgata vāc jñāna samayam aśeṣa anavaśeṣa sattvadhātu vāc siddhi sarva sukha saumanasya anubhavana artham yāvat sarva tathāgata vāc guhya tā prāpti uttama siddhaye tad vajra jāpam tasmai avācāya mahā bodhisattvāya tathā eva pāṇibhyām anuprādāt
translated: In order to attain the supreme accomplishment of the stage of the wisdom of the speech of all Tathagatas, the accomplishment of speech for all sentient beings without exception, the experience of all happiness and joy, and the attainment of the secret speech of all Tathagatas, he bestowed that Vajra Recitation upon that Bodhisattva Mahasattva Avaivartika-cakra, placing it in his hands.

analyzed: tatas sarva tathāgataiḥ vajra vācaḥ vajra vācaḥ iti vajra nāma abhiṣekeṇa abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: Then all the Tathagatas consecrated him with the Vajra Name Consecration, calling him Vajra Speech, Vajra Speech.

original: atha vajravāco bodhisattvo mahāsattvastena vajrajāpena sarvatathāgatān saṃllāpayannidamudānamudānayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha vajravācaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tena vajra jāpena sarva tathāgatān saṃllāpayan idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Mahasattva Vajra Speech, with that Vajra Recitation, addressing all the Tathagatas, uttered this udana:

analyzed: idam tat sarva buddhānām vajra jāpam udāhṛtam
translated: This is declared to be the Vajra Recitation of all the Buddhas,

analyzed: sarva tathāgatānām tu mantrāṇām āśu sādhanam iti
translated: The swift accomplishment of the mantras of all the Tathagatas.
The knowledge of the vajra nature.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata prajñā jñānam
translated: The knowledge of the wisdom of all Tathagatas.
The knowledge of turning the great wheel.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata vāc prapañca vinivartana jñānam ca iti
translated: The knowledge of turning away the proliferation of speech of all Tathagatas.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata mahā jñāna sattvāḥ
translated: They are the great beings of the great knowledge of all Tathagatas.

analyzed: vajrakarma
translated: Vajra Action

analyzed: atha bhagavān sarva tathāgata viśvakarma mahā bodhisattva samaya saṃbhava karma adhiṣṭhāna vajram nāma samādhim samāpadya
translated: Then the Blessed One entered the concentration called Vajra Empowerment of the Arisen Action, the Great Bodhisattva Samaya of All Tathagatas' Action,

analyzed: idam sarva tathāgata karma samayat nāma sarva tathāgata hṛdayam sva hṛdayāt niścacāra vajra karma
translated: and this heart of all the Tathagatas called All Tathagata Action Samaya came forth from his heart: Vajra Karma.

original: athāsmin viniḥsṛtamātre sarvatathāgatahṛdayebhyaḥ sarvakarmasamatājñānasuprativedhatvāt vajrasattvasamādheḥ sa eva bhagavan vajradharaḥ sarvatathāgatakarmasamayo bhūtvā viniḥsṛtaḥ /
analyzed: atha asmin viniḥsṛta mātre sarva tathāgata hṛdayebhyaḥ sarva karma samatā jñāna su prativedha tvāt vajra sattva samādheḥ saḥ eva bhagavan vajradharaḥ sarva tathāgata karma samayaḥ bhūtvā viniḥsṛtaḥ
translated: As soon as it had come forth from the hearts of all the Tathagatas, because of the knowledge of the equality of all actions and the excellent penetration of the Vajra-Being concentration, that Blessed One, Vajradhara, became the All Tathagata Action Samaya and came forth.

analyzed: taiḥ ca sarva tathāgata karma raśmibhiḥ sarva lokadhātavaḥ bhāsitāḥ
translated: And with those rays of action of all the Tathagatas, all the world realms were illuminated.

analyzed: sarva tathāgata karmadhātu mayāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ
translated: They became full of the essence of the action of all the Tathagatas.

original: sa sakalaḥ sarvatathāgatakarmadhāturbhagavato vairocanasya hṛdaye praviṣṭvaikaghanaḥ sarvākāśadhātusamavasaraṇapramāṇastataḥ sarvatathāgatakarmadhātutaḥ karmavajravigrahaḥ prādurbhūya /
analyzed: sa sakalaḥ sarva tathāgata karmadhātuḥ bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye praviṣṭvā eka ghanaḥ sarva ākāśa dhātu samavasaraṇa pramāṇaḥ tatas sarva tathāgata karmadhātutaḥ karma vajra vigrahaḥ prādurbhūya
translated: That complete essence of the action of all the Tathagatas entered the heart of the Blessed One Vairocana, and becoming one whole, the size of the whole realm of space, from that essence of the action of all the Tathagatas, he appeared in the form of Karmavajra.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ pāṇau pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: and remained in the Blessed One's hand.

analyzed: atha tatas karma vajra vigrahāt sarva lokadhātu paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ tathāgata vigrahāḥ viniḥsṛtya
translated: Then from that form of Karmavajra, the Tathagata forms equal to the atoms of all world systems emerged,

analyzed: sarva lokadhātuṣu sarva tathāgata karma ādīni sarva buddha ṛddhi vikurvitāni kṛtvā
translated: and having performed all the Tathagata activities and so forth in all world systems, all the Buddha miracles and wonders,

analyzed: sarva tathāgata ananta karma tvāt vajra sattva samādheḥ su dṛḍha tvāt ca eka ghanaḥ sarva tathāgata viśva karma mahā bodhisattva kāyaḥ saṃbhūya
translated: due to the infinite activities of all Tathagatas and the extreme firmness of the Vajrasattva samadhi, they combined and became one body, the great Bodhisattva form of all Tathagatas, Vishvakarma.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya hṛdaye sthitvā idam udānam udānayāmāsa
translated: and having appeared in the heart of the Blessed One Vairochana, he uttered this exalted utterance:

analyzed: aho hi amogham buddhānām sarva karmam aham bahu
translated: Ah! The activities of the Buddhas are indeed inexhaustible and manifold,

analyzed: yat anābhoga buddha artham vajra karma pravartate

analyzed: initiation of the disciple
translated: Initiation of the Disciple

analyzed: atha atra vajra dhātu mahā maṇḍale vajra śiṣya praveśa ādi vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now, here in the Vajradhātu Mahāmaṇḍala, there is the extensive procedure for the entry of the vajra disciple and so forth.

analyzed: tatra prathamam tāvat praveśaḥ bhavati aśeṣa anavaśeṣa sattvadhātu paritrāṇa sarva hita sukha uttama siddhi kārya karaṇa tayā
translated: There, first of all, the entry is for the sake of accomplishing the highest benefit and happiness of all sentient beings without exception.

analyzed: atra mahā maṇḍala praveśe pātra apātra parīkṣā na kāryā
translated: In this entry into the great maṇḍala, one should not examine whether one is a suitable vessel or not.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: santi bhagavantastathāgatāḥ kecit sattvā mahāpāpakāriṇaste idaṃ vajradhātumahāmaṇḍalaṃ dṛṣṭvā praviṣṭā ca sarvāpāyavigatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: santi bhagavantaḥ tathāgatāḥ kecid sattvāḥ mahā pāpa kāriṇaḥ te idam vajradhātu mahā maṇḍalam dṛṣṭvā praviṣṭā ca sarva apāya vigatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Blessed Ones, there are some sentient beings who commit great evil deeds. Having seen this Vajradhātu Mahāmaṇḍala and entered it, they will be free from all lower realms.

original: santi ca bhagavantaḥ sattvāḥ sarvārthabhojanapānakāmaguṇagṛddhāḥ samayadviṣṭāḥ puraścaraṇādiṣvaśaktāḥ /
analyzed: santi ca bhagavantaḥ sattvāḥ sarva artha bhojana pāna kāma guṇa gṛddhāḥ samaya dviṣṭāḥ puraścaraṇa ādiṣu aśaktāḥ
translated: Blessed Ones, there are also sentient beings who are greedy for all sense objects, food, drink, and sensual pleasures, who hate the samaya, and are unable to perform the preliminary practices and so forth.

analyzed: teṣām api atra yathākāma karaṇīya tayā praviṣṭānām sarva āśā paripūriḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For them also, having entered here as they wish, all wishes will be fulfilled.

analyzed: santi bhagavantaḥ sattvāḥ nṛtya gīta hāsya lāsya āhāra vihāra priya tayā sarva tathāgata mahāyāna abhisamaya dharmatā anavabodha tvāt anya devakula maṇḍalāni praviśanti
translated: There are beings, O Blessed One, who, due to their love for dancing, singing, laughing, acting, eating, and enjoying, and due to their lack of understanding of the nature of the great vehicle of all tathāgatas, enter other family and maṇḍala [rites].

original: sarvāśāparipūrisaṃpadabhūteṣu niruttararatiprītiharṣasaṃbhavakareṣu sarvatathāgatakulamaṇḍaleṣu śikṣāpadabhayabhītā na praviśanti /
analyzed: sarva āśā paripūri saṃpada bhūteṣu niruttara rati prīti harṣa saṃbhava kareṣu sarva tathāgata kula maṇḍaleṣu śikṣā pada bhaya bhītāḥ na praviśanti
translated: Fearing the precepts in the maṇḍalas of all tathāgata families, which are the source of the unsurpassed bliss, joy, and delight that fulfill all wishes and are endowed with all good fortune, they do not enter.

analyzed: teṣām apāya maṇḍala praveśa pathā abhimukha vihārāṇām api eva vajradhātu mahā maṇḍala praveśaḥ yujyata sarva rati prīti uttama siddhi sukha saumanasya anubhavana artham sarva apāya gati praveśa abhimukha patha vinivartanāya ca
translated: For them, who are facing the path of entering the maṇḍala of lower realms, it is fitting to enter the great maṇḍala of the vajra realm, in order to experience the bliss and happiness of the supreme accomplishment of all joys and delights, and to turn away from the path of facing the entry into all lower realms.

original: santi ca punarbhagavanto dhārmikāḥ sattvāḥ sarvatathāgataśīlasamādhiprajñottamasiddhyupāyairbuddhabodhiṃ prārthayanto dhyānavimokṣādibhirbhūmibhiryantaḥ kliśyante /
analyzed: santi ca punar bhagavantaḥ dhārmikāḥ sattvāḥ sarva tathāgata śīla samādhi prajñā uttama siddhi upāyaiḥ buddha bodhim prārthayantaḥ dhyāna vimokṣa ādibhiḥ bhūmibhiḥ yantaḥ kliśyante
translated: And again, Blessed Ones, there are virtuous beings who, seeking the Buddha's enlightenment through the means of accomplishing the supreme morality, concentration, and wisdom of all the Tathagatas, are striving with the meditations, liberations, and so forth, and are suffering.

analyzed: teṣām atrā eva vajra dhātu mahā maṇḍala praveśa mātreṇa eva sarva tathāgata tvam api na durlabham
translated: For them, even the state of being all the Tathagatas is not difficult to attain merely by entering this great mandala of the vajra realm.

analyzed: kim aṅgā punar anyā siddhiḥ iti

original: tatrādita eva tāvat sarvatathāgatapraṇāmacatuṣṭayaṃ kārayet / tadyathā /
analyzed: tatra āditas eva tāvat sarva tathāgata praṇāma catuṣṭayam kārayet tat yathā
translated: There, first of all, one should perform the four salutations to all the Tathagatas, namely:

analyzed: sarva śarīreṇa vajra añjali prasāritena praṇamet anena mantreṇa

analyzed: sthitaḥ vajra añjalim hṛdi kṛtvā lalāṭena praṇamet anena mantreṇa om sarva tathāgata pūjā abhiṣekāya ātmānan niryātayāmi sava tathāgata vajra ratna abhiṣiñca mām
translated: Standing thus, with the vajra-folded hands at the heart, one should prostrate with the forehead, with this mantra: Om, for the consecration of the worship of all the Tathagatas, I offer myself. O Vajra-Jewel of all the Tathagatas, consecrate me!

original: tatastathaivotthāya vajrāṃjalibandhena śirasā mukhena praṇamedanena mantreṇa oṃ sarvatathāgatapūjāpravartanāyātmānaṃ niryātayāmi sarvatathāgatavajradharma pravartaya mām //

translated: Then, rising up just as before, one should bow with one's head, face, and vajra-clasped hands to the feet of all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, with this mantra: Om, I offer myself to engage in the worship of all Tathagatas. Cause me to engage in the vajra Dharma of all Tathagatas.

original: tatastathaiva sthito vajrāṃjaliṃ śiraso'vatārya hṛdi kṛtvā murdhnā praṇamedanena mantreṇa oṃ sarvatathāgatapūjākarmaṇe ātmānanniryātayāmi sarvatathātavajrakarma kuru mām //
analyzed: tatas tathā eva sthitaḥ vajra aṃjalim śirasā uvatārya hṛdi kṛtvā murdhnā praṇamet anena mantreṇa om sarva tathāgata pūjā karmaṇe ātmānan niryātayāmi kuru mām
translated: Then, standing just as before, having lowered the vajra-clasped hands from the head and placed them on the heart, one should bow with one's head, with this mantra: Om, I offer myself to engage in the activity of worshiping all Tathagatas. Cause me to engage in the vajra activity of all Tathagatas.

analyzed: dadyāt

original: vajragītā sugītā tvaṃ vajranṛtyā ca vaśayet // //

analyzed: dhūpayā tu manaḥ ulhādam puṣpayā ābharaṇāni tu

original: bandhayed vajranigaḍā vajraghaṇṭā tu cālayed // iti // //
analyzed: bandhayet vajra nigaḍā vajra ghaṇṭā tu cālayet iti
translated: One should bind with Vajra-Nigarḍī; Vajra-Ghaṇṭā should be moved.

analyzed: atha sarva mudrāṇām sāmānyā bandha vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati

analyzed: tatas sarva mudrā bandhāḥ sva kāya vāc citta vajreṣu vaśībhavanti

analyzed: tatas vajra āveśa samaya mudrām badhvā

analyzed: idam hṛdayam uccārayet aḥ

analyzed: tatas samāviṣṭāḥ mitra tvena upatiṣṭhanti

analyzed: tatas mudrā samaya mahāsattvān anusmṛtya idam hṛdayam udāharet mahā samaya sattva ūham
translated: Then, having recollected the great beings of the mudra samaya, one should utter this heart: I am the great samaya being.

analyzed: anena sarva mudrāḥ siddhyanti iti
translated: By this, all the mudras are accomplished.

analyzed: sarva mudrā vidhi vistaraḥ
translated: The extensive method of all the mudras.

original: atha sāmānyaḥ sādhanavidhivistaro bhavati /🔽tatrādita eva svamudrāṃ badhvā svamudrāsatvamātmānaṃ bhāvayedanena hṛdayena samayo'ham //
analyzed: atha sāmānyaḥ sādhana vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati  tatra āditas eva sva mudrām badhvā sva mudrā sattvam ātmānam bhāvayet anena hṛdayena samayaḥ ūham
translated: Now, there is the extensive method of the common practice.🔽There, having first made one's own mudra, one should contemplate oneself as the being of one's own mudra with this heart: samaya I am.

original: tataḥ svamudrāsattvamātmānaṃ bhāvya tenādhiṣṭhāyedanena mantreṇa samayasattvādhitiṣṭhasva mām /

analyzed: tatas sādhayet iti
translated: Then, one should accomplish it.

analyzed: atha siddhi vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now follows the extensive ritual of accomplishment.

original: tatrādita eva arthasiddhimicchatā tena hṛdayena arthasiddhi //
analyzed: tatra āditas eva artha siddhim icchatā tena hṛdayena
translated: There, one who desires accomplishment of wealth should accomplish it with that heart-mantra, the accomplishment of wealth.

analyzed: anena siddhā mudrā mahārtha utpattin karoti
translated: With this accomplished mudrā, one generates the arising of great wealth.

analyzed: atha vajra siddhim icchet anena hṛdayena
translated: If one desires the accomplishment of the vajra, with this heart-mantra, the vajra accomplishment.

analyzed: anena yathā abhirucita vajra siddhaḥ bhavati
translated: With this, one becomes accomplished in the vajra as one desires.

analyzed: atha vidyādhara siddhim icchet anena hṛdayena vajra vidyādhara
translated: If one desires the accomplishment of the vidyādhara, with this heart-mantra, the vajra vidyādhara.

analyzed: anena yathā abhirucita vidyādhara siddhiḥ
translated: With this, one attains the accomplishment of the vidyādhara as one desires.

analyzed: atha uttama siddhim icchet sva mudrā hṛdayena iti
translated: If one desires the supreme accomplishment, with one's own mudrā heart-mantra.
The extensive ritual of accomplishment.

original: atha sarvamudrāṇāṃ sāmānyaḥ svakāyavākcittavajreṣu vajrīkaraṇavidhivistaro bhavati /
analyzed: atha sarva mudrāṇām sāmānyaḥ sva kāya vāc citta vajreṣu vajrīkaraṇa vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now follows the extensive ritual of vajra-fication in one's own body, speech, and mind, the general ritual of all mudrās.

analyzed: yadā mudrā adhiṣṭhānam śithilībhavati
translated: When the consecration of the mudrā becomes loose,

analyzed: svayam vā muktu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: or if one oneself desires to be released,

analyzed: tatā unena hṛdayena dṛḍhīkartavyā  om vajra sattva samayam anupālaya
translated: then one should stabilize it with this heart-mantra.🔽Oṃ, vajra, guard the pledge of the sattva.

analyzed: vajra sattva tvena upatiṣṭha
translated: Be present as the vajra sattva.

analyzed: dṛḍhaḥ me bhava
translated: Be firm for me.

analyzed: su toṣyaḥ me bhava anuraktaḥ me
translated: You are easily satisfied, you are devoted to me,

analyzed: bhava su poṣyaḥ me bhava
translated: you are well nourished by me,

analyzed: sarva siddhim ca me prayaccha
translated: you grant me all accomplishments,

original: sarvakarmasu ca me cittaśreyaḥ kuru hūṃ
analyzed: sarva karmasu ca me citta śreyaḥ kuru hūm
translated: and you make my mind excellent in all actions. Hūṃ

original: ha ha ha ha hoḥ bhagavan sarvatathāgatavajra mā me muṃca /
analyzed: ha ha ha ha hoḥ bhagavan sarva tathāgata vajra mā me muṃca
translated: Ha ha ha ha hoḥ, Blessed One, Vajra of all Tathāgatas, do not abandon me.

analyzed: vajrībhava mahā samaya satvaḥ āḥ
translated: Become vajra, great being of the great pledge, āḥ.

original: anenānantaryakāriṇo'pi sarvatathāgatamokṣā api saddharmapratikṣepakā api sarvaduṣkṛtakāriṇo'pi sarvatathāgatamudrāsādhakā varjasattvadṛḍhībhāvādihaiva janmanyāsu yathābhirucitāṃ sarvasiddhimuttamasiddhiṃ vajrasiddhiṃ vajrasattvasiddhiṃ vā yāvat tathāgatasiddhiṃ vā prāpsyantītyāha bhagavāṃ sarvatathāgatavajrasattvaḥ //
analyzed: anena ānantarya kāriṇaḥ api sarva tathāgata mokṣāḥ api saddharma pratikṣepakāḥ api sarva duṣkṛta kāriṇaḥ api sarva tathāgata mudrā sādhakāḥ varja sattva dṛḍhībhāvāt iha eva janmani āsu yathā abhirucitām sarva siddhim uttama siddhim vajra siddhim vajrasattva siddhim vā yāvat tathāgata siddhim vā prāpsyanti iti āha bhagavān sarva tathāgata vajrasattvaḥ  /
translated: By this, even those who have committed the acts of immediate retribution, even those who have been expelled from the doctrine of all Tathāgatas, even those who have rejected the true Dharma, even those who have done all evil deeds, even those who practice the mudrās of all Tathāgatas, will attain the highest accomplishment, the vajra accomplishment, the vajrasattva accomplishment, up to the tathāgata accomplishment, in this very life, as they desire, by the power of the firm being. Thus spoke the Blessed One, the Vajrasattva of all Tathāgatas.

analyzed: atha sva mudrāṇām sāmānyaḥ mokṣa vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now, the extensive ritual for releasing the common mudrās is as follows.

original: tatrādita eva yatoyataḥ samutpannā mudrā tān tatratatraiva muñcedanena hṛdayena vajra muḥ //
analyzed: tatra āditas eva yatas yatas samutpannā mudrā tān tatra tatra eva muñcet anena hṛdayena vajra

original: tato hṛdayotthitayā ratnavajrimudrayā svābhiṣekasthānasthitayābhiṣicyāgrāṅgulibhyāṃ mālāṃ veṣṭavyaṃ badhvā tathaiva kavacaṃ bandhayedanena hṛdayena oṃ ratnavajrābhiṣiñca sarvamudrā me dṛḍhīkuru varakavacena vam //
analyzed: tatas hṛdaya utthitayā ratna vajri mudrayā sva abhiṣeka sthāna sthitayā abhiṣicya agra aṅgulibhyām mālām veṣṭavyam badhvā tathā eva kavacam bandhayet anena hṛdayena om ratna vajra abhiṣiñca sarva mudrāḥ me dṛḍhīkuru vara kavacena vaṃ
translated: Then, with the Ratnavajrī mudrā arisen from the heart, located in the place of one's own consecration, one should consecrate oneself, and with the tips of the index fingers one should wind the garland, and having tied it, one should bind the armor in the same way with this heart: Oṃ Ratnavajrā consecrate, make all my mudrās firm with the excellent armor, vaṃ.

analyzed: tatas punar kavaca antam mālābandham kṛtvā
translated: Then, again, having made the garland binding up to the armor,

Vajrasattva, recited once, by one whose nature is as one desires,

analyzed: sidhyate jāpa mātreṇa vajrapāṇi vacaḥ yathā

analyzed: iti āha bhagavān samantabhadraḥ

analyzed: vajra sattva ādi sattvānām sarva sādhana karmasu

analyzed: jāpaḥ tu rucitaḥ api atra sarva kalpeṣu siddhi daḥ

analyzed: hṛd mudrā mantra vidyānām yathā abhirucitaiḥ nayaiḥ
translated: By the methods as one desires of the heart, mudrās, mantras, and vidyās,

translated: Om! By the gathering of vajra beings, the unsurpassed vajra jewel,

analyzed: vajra dharma gāyanaiḥ ca vajra karma karaḥ bhava  tatobhyantara maṇḍale pi anena eva vajra stuti gītena vajranṛtya kara puṭena gṛhya dhūpa ādibhiḥ pūjā kāryā

analyzed: tatas bāhya maṇḍale vajra dhūpa ādibhiḥ pūjām kṛtvā

translated: having satisfied everyone with all the tastes, foods, enjoyments, and so on, as they entered and as they can afford, with all the requisites offered in the great mandala, one should give this vow of the vajra accomplishment of all Tathagatas.

analyzed: gacchadhvam buddha viṣayam punar āgamanāya tu

analyzed: vajra sattva muḥ

analyzed: evam sarva maṇḍaleṣu kartavyam

analyzed: samaya agryāḥ mudrāsu ca mā uktaḥ iti

analyzed: samanantara samāpanne ca atha tāvat eva sarva tathāgata hṛdayebhyaḥ

analyzed: saḥ eva bhagavān vajrapāṇiḥ vajradhara rūpa dhāriṇyaḥ samanta jvālā garbhāḥ vajra dhāraṇī samaya mudrāḥ devatāḥ bhūtvā viniḥsṛtya
translated: the Blessed One Vajrapani himself, in the form of Vajradhara, blazing with light all around, in the form of the deity of the Dharani Seal of the Commitment of Vajra Dharani, emerged.

analyzed: sarva lokadhātuṣu sarva buddhānām sarva tathāgata vajra dhāraṇī jñānāni niṣpādya
translated: Having accomplished the knowledge of the vajra dharani of all Buddhas and all Tathagatas in all world systems,

translated: becoming the images of the seals of the commitment of all Tathagatas,

translated: he took his place in the great mandala of the vajra realm of all Tathagatas, and, relying on the lunar discs, he uttered this udana:

analyzed: aho hi bodhi cittasya sarva satva hita eṣitā
translated: Ah! The altruism of the enlightened mind,

analyzed: yat vinaya vaśāt dhīrāḥ strī rūpam api kurvate
translated: By which the wise, out of compassion, even assume the form of a woman.

analyzed: emanation of deities from samadhi
translated: Emanation of deities from samadhi

original: atha bhagavān sarvatathāgatajñānamudrāsamayavajradhātvadhiṣṭhānaṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpadyemāṃ svavidyāttamāmabhāṣat oṃ vajradhātvīśvari hūṃ vajriṇi🔽atha khalvakṣobhayastathāgataḥ sarvatathāgatavajrasatvasamayajñānamudrāmaṇḍalādhiṣṭhānan nāma samādhiṃ samāpadyemāṃ svavidyottamāmabhāṣat oṃ vajravajriṇi hūṃ //
analyzed: atha bhagavān sarva tathāgata jñāna mudrā samaya vajradhātu adhiṣṭhānam nāma samādhim samāpadya imām sva vidyāt tamām abhāṣat om vajradhātu īśvari hūm vajriṇi  atha khalu akṣobhayaḥ tathāgataḥ sarva tathāgata vajra satva samaya jñāna mudrā maṇḍala adhiṣṭhānat nāma samādhim samāpadya imām sva vidyā uttamām abhāṣat om vajra vajriṇi hūm
translated: Then the Blessed One entered the concentration called The Empowerment of the Vajra Realm of the Seal of Commitment of the Knowledge of All the Tathagatas, and uttered this his own knowledge spell: Om Vajradhatvishvari Hum Vajriņi.🔽 Then the Tathagata Akshobhya entered the concentration called The Empowerment of the Mandala of the Seal of Knowledge of the Commitment of the Vajra Being of All the Tathagatas, and uttered this his own knowledge spell: Om Vajra Vajriņi Hum.

original: atha ratnasaṃbhavastathāgataḥ sarvatathāgatavajraratnasamayajñānamudrāmaṇḍalādhiṣṭhānan nāma samādhiṃ samāpadyemāṃ svavidyottamāmabhāṣat oṃ ratnavajriṇi hūṃ //
analyzed: atha ratnasaṃbhavaḥ tathāgataḥ sarva tathāgata vajra ratna samaya jñāna mudrā maṇḍala adhiṣṭhānat nāma samādhim samāpadya imām sva vidyā uttamām abhāṣat om ratnavajriṇi hūm
translated: Then the Tathagata Ratnasambhava entered the concentration called The Empowerment of the Mandala of the Seal of Knowledge of the Commitment of the Vajra Jewel of All the Tathagatas, and uttered this his own knowledge spell: Om Ratna Vajriņi Hum.

original: athāmitāyustathāgataḥ sarvatathāgatavajradharmasamayajñānamudrāmaṇḍalādhiṣṭhānan nāma samādhiṃ samāpadyemāṃ svavidyottamāmabhāṣat oṃ dharmavajriṇi hūṃ //
analyzed: atha amitāyuḥ tathāgataḥ sarva tathāgata vajra dharma samaya jñāna mudrā maṇḍala adhiṣṭhānat nāma samādhim samāpadya imām sva vidyā uttamām abhāṣat om dharmavajriṇi hūm
translated: Then the Tathagata Amitayus entered the concentration called The Empowerment of the Mandala of the Seal of Knowledge of the Commitment of the Vajra Dharma of All the Tathagatas, and uttered this his own knowledge spell: Om Dharma Vajriņi Hum.

original: athāmoghasiddhistathāgataḥ sarvatathāgatavajrakarnasamayajñānamudrāmaṇḍalādhiṣṭhānan nāma samādhiṃ samāpadyemāṃ svavidyottamāmabhāṣat oṃ karmavajriṇi hūṃ //
analyzed: atha amoghasiddhiḥ tathāgataḥ nāma samādhim samāpadya imām sva vidyā uttamām abhāṣat om karmavajriṇi hūm
