original: atha maheśvaro mahādevaḥ sakalaṃ trailokyaṃ mahākrodhāviṣṭamadhiṣṭhāya / evamāha /🔽tvamapi mamājñāṃ pālaya /
analyzed: atha maheśvaraḥ mahādevaḥ sakalam trailokyam mahā krodha āviṣṭam adhiṣṭhāya evam āha  tvam api mama ājñām pālaya
translated: Then Mahesvara Mahadeva, empowering the entire three worlds, which were filled with great anger, said this:🔽You also protect my command.

original: samaye ca prati padya / i ti //
analyzed: samaye ca prati padye i ti
translated: And acknowledge the pledge.

analyzed: atha vajrāpāṇiḥ mahā krodha rājaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, the great lord of wrath, said this to the Blessed One:

original: ayambhagavanmahādevo devaḥ svajñānabalagarvāt maheśvaryā dhipa tyāt ca sarvatathāgataśāsane na praṇamati /
analyzed: ayam bhagavat mahādevaḥ devaḥ sva jñāna bala garvāt maheśvaryāḥ dhipa tyāt ca sarva tathāgata śāsane na praṇamati
translated: Blessed One, this great god Maheśvara, out of pride in the power of his own knowledge and because of his lordship over Maheśvarī, does not bow to the teaching of all the Tathāgatas.

analyzed: tat katham asya kriyate iti
translated: What should be done to him?

original: atha bhagavān sarvatathāgatahṛdayasaṃbhūtaṃ mahāvajrasa mayaṃ smārayati oṃ nisumbha vajra huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha bhagavān sarva tathāgata hṛdaya saṃbhūtam mahā vajra sa mayam smārayati om nisumbha vajra hum phaṭ
translated: Then the Blessed One, having arisen from the heart of all the Tathāgatas, said this to Vajrapāṇi: O Vajrapāṇi, subdue this Maheśvara!

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ sva vajra hṛdayam udājahāra hum
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, the great Bodhisattva, uttered his own vajra heart: Hum!

original: athāsmin bhāṣitamātra sakalatraidhātukasannipatitā mahādevādayaḥ sarvatrailokyādhipatayaḥ adhomukhāḥ prapatitāḥ ārtasvaraṃ manvanto bhagavato vajrapāṇeśca śaraṇaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātra sakala traidhātuka sannipatitāḥ mahādeva ādayaḥ sarva trailokya adhipatayaḥ adhomukhāḥ prapatitāḥ ārta svaram manvantaḥ bhagavataḥ vajrapāṇeḥ ca śaraṇam gatāḥ
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, all the lords of the three worlds, headed by Maheśvara, who had assembled in the entire three realms, fell face down, wailing in distress, and took refuge in the Blessed One and Vajrapāṇi.

original: sa ca mahādevo devo bhūmyāṃ prapatito niśceṣṭībhūto mṛtaḥ //
analyzed: sa ca mahādevaḥ devaḥ bhūmyām prapatitaḥ niśceṣṭībhūtaḥ mṛtaḥ
translated: And that great god Maheśvara fell to the ground, became motionless, and died.

analyzed: atha bhagavān jānan eva vajrapāṇim evam āha
translated: Then the Blessed One, although knowing, said this to Vajrapāṇi:

analyzed: pratipadyasva vajrapāṇe asya sakala tri loka cakrasya abhayāya
translated: Vajrapāṇi, take care of this entire wheel of the three worlds for the sake of fearlessness.

analyzed: mā pañcatvam āpādaya
translated: Do not bring about the state of five-fold [death].

original: atha vajrapāṇirmahākrodharājo bhagavato vacanamupaśrutya tāṃ sarvadevādīnāhūyaivamāha /
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā krodha rājaḥ bhagavataḥ vacanam upaśrutya tām sarva deva ādīn āhūya evam āha
translated: Then Vajrapani, the great king of wrathful ones, having heard the words of the Blessed One, summoned all the gods and others, and said this:

original: buddhaṃ dharma saṅghaṃ ca śaraṇaṃ pratipadyata /
analyzed: buddham dharma saṅgham ca śaraṇam pratipadyata
translated: Take refuge in the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.

analyzed: mama ājñā kāritāyām ca
translated: And obey my command.

analyzed: yadi iṣṭam vaḥ sva jīvitam iti
translated: If you want to keep your own life.

analyzed: atha te evam āhuḥ
translated: Then they said this:

analyzed: sa buddha dharma saṅgha samudrān śaraṇam gacchāmaḥ
translated: We go for refuge to the ocean of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.

analyzed: tvad śāsana ājñām na jānīmaḥ iti
translated: We do not know how to obey your command.

analyzed: atha bhagavān vairocanaḥ tathāgataḥ tān āhūya evam āha
translated: Then the Blessed One Vairocana, the Tathagata, summoned them and said this:

original: ayaṃ bho devo'smākaṃ sarvatathāgatādhipatiḥ sarvatathāgatapitā sarvatathāgatājñākaraḥ sarvatathāgatajyeṣṭhaputro bhagavāṃ samantabhadro bodhisatvo mahāsatvaḥ sarvasatvavinayena kāryakaraṇatayā mahākrodharājyatāyāmabhiṣiktaḥ /
analyzed: ayam bho devaḥ usmākam sarva tathāgata adhipatiḥ sarva tathāgata pitā sarva tathāgata ājñākaraḥ sarva tathāgata jyeṣṭha putraḥ bhagavām samantabhadraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ sarva satva vinayena kārya karaṇa tayā mahā krodha rājya tāyām abhiṣiktaḥ
translated: O gods, this Blessed One Samantabhadra, the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, is our lord of all Tathagatas, the father of all Tathagatas, the one who carries out the command of all Tathagatas, the eldest son of all Tathagatas. He has been consecrated to the kingship of the great wrathful ones in order to carry out the task of taming all beings.

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: santi yuṣmadmadhye mahādevādayo duṣṭagaṇās te sarvatathāgatairapi na śakyāḥ śāntayā pāpebhyo nivārayituṃ /
analyzed: santi yuṣmad madhye mahādeva ādayaḥ duṣṭa gaṇāḥ te sarva tathāgataiḥ api na śakyāḥ śāntayā pāpebhyaḥ nivārayitum
translated: There are evil groups such as Maheśvara among you, whom all the Tathāgatas are unable to restrain from evil by peaceful means.

original: teṣāṃ pāpasatvānāṃ nigrahāya adhitiṣṭhitastadyusmābhirasya samaye sthātavyamityājñā iti /
analyzed: teṣām pāpa satvānām nigrahāya adhitiṣṭhitaḥ tat yusmābhiḥ asya samaye sthātavyam iti ājñā iti
translated: For the restraint of those evil beings, I have empowered you. You should abide by this agreement.

analyzed: te evam āhuḥ
translated: They said this:

analyzed: asmākam bhagavan asmāt jīvita vipralāyāt paritrāyasva
translated: O Blessed One, save us from this danger to our lives.

analyzed: yām ājñān dāsyati tat kariṣyamahe iti
translated: We will do whatever you command.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: haṃ bho mārṣā etameva śaraṇaṃ gacchatāyameva vaḥ paritrāsyati / nānya iti //
analyzed: ham bho mārṣāḥ etam eva śaraṇam gacchata ayam eva vaḥ paritrāsyati na anyaḥ iti
translated: O friends, go for refuge to him alone. He alone will protect you, not another.

original: atha te trilokasakalatraidhātukasannipatitāḥ tribhuva napata yo yena bhagavān vajradharastenābhimukhā ekakaṇṭhena mahārtān svarānpramuñcata evamāhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te triloka sakala traidhātuka sannipatitāḥ yaḥ yena bhagavān vajradharaḥ tena abhimukhāḥ eka kaṇṭhena mahā ārtān svarān pramuñcate evam āhuḥ
translated: Then those who had assembled from the three worlds, the entire three realms, the lords of the three worlds, facing the Blessed Vajra Holder, with one voice let out great piteous cries and said this:

original: paritrāyasva bho bhagavan paritrāyasva ato maraṇaduḥkhād iti //
analyzed: paritrāyasva bho bhagavan paritrāyasva atas maraṇa duḥkhāt iti
translated: O Blessed One, save us from this suffering of death!

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ tām deva ādīn āhūya evam āha
translated: Then the great Bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, having summoned the gods and others, said this:

original: haṃ bho duṣṭāḥ pratipadyata mama śāsane /
analyzed: ham bho duṣṭāḥ pratipadyata mama śāsane
translated: O evil ones, accept my command.

original: mā vo dīptenā nena vajreṇa ekajvālīkṛtya /
analyzed: mā vaḥ dīptena ā nena vajreṇa eka jvālīkṛtya
translated: Do not be burned by my blazing vajra, turned into a single flame,

analyzed: sarvān eva bhasmīkuryām iti
translated: With this blazing vajra, I will reduce you all to ashes, burning you all into a single flame.

analyzed: te evam āhuḥ
translated: They said this:

analyzed: samantabhadraḥ tvam bhagavan sarva tathāgata citta utpādaḥ śānta vinītaḥ sarva satva hita eṣī sarva satva abhaya pradaḥ
translated: You are Samantabhadra, O Blessed One, the generation of the mind of all Tathāgatas, peaceful and disciplined, wishing for the welfare of all beings, the giver of fearlessness to all beings.

analyzed: tat katham bhagavan asmākat nirdahiṣyati iti
translated: How then, O Blessed One, will you burn us?

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā krodharajaḥ tān evam āha
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, the great king of wrath, said to them:

original: ahaṃ bho mārṣāḥ samantabhadro yena sarvatathāgatājñākāritvādyuṣmadvidhānāṃ duṣṭasatvajātīyānāṃ pāpacittānāṃ saṃśodhanārthāya /
analyzed: aham bho mārṣāḥ samantabhadraḥ yena sarva tathāgata ājñā kāri tvāt yuṣmadvidhānām duṣṭa satva jātīyānām pāpa cittānām saṃśodhana arthāya
translated: O friends, I am Samantabhadra, in order to carry out the command of all Tathāgatas, for the purification of evil minds of wicked beings like you.

original: vināśayāmi yadi matsamaye na tiṣṭhata iti /
analyzed: vināśayāmi yadi mad samaye na tiṣṭhate iti
translated: If you do not abide by my command, I will destroy you.

analyzed: te prāhuḥ evam astu i ti
translated: They said, So be it!

original: atha vajrapāṇirmahākrodharājo maheśvaraṃ muktvānyāndevānāśvāsyotthāpanārthamidam vajrottiṣṭhannāma sarvatathāgatahṛdayamabhāṣat vajrottiṣṭha
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā krodha rājaḥ maheśvaram muktvā anyān devān āśvāsya utthāpana artham idam vajra uttiṣṭhat nāma sarva tathāgata hṛdayam abhāṣat vajra uttiṣṭha
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, the great king of wrath, having comforted the gods except Maheśvara, in order to raise them up, spoke this vajroṣṇīṣ, the heart of all Tathāgatas: Vajroṣṇīṣ.

original: athāsmin bhāṣitamātre maheśvaraṃ muktvā sarve te tridhātukasannipatitāstribhuvanapatayaḥ saparivārāḥ saṃmūrcchitāḥ samānāḥ samāśvastahṛdayā abhūvan divyāni sukhānyanubhavanto vigatabhayacchabhitaromaharṣā bhagavantaṃ vajrapāṇinamavalokayantaḥ samutthitā iti //
analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātre maheśvaram muktvā sarve te tri dhātuka sannipatitāḥ tribhuvana patayaḥ sa parivārāḥ saṃmūrcchitāḥ samānāḥ samāśvasta hṛdayāḥ abhūvan divyāni sukhāni anubhavantaḥ vigata bhaya chabhita romaharṣāḥ bhagavantam vajrapāṇinam avalokayantaḥ samutthitāḥ iti
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, all those lords of the three worlds, along with their retinues, who had assembled in the three realms, except for Maheśvara, having fainted, regained consciousness and became comforted in their hearts, experiencing divine bliss, free from fear, terror, and horripilation, they arose and gazed at Lord Vajrapāṇi.

analyzed: atha bhagavān vajrapāṇim bodhisatvam āmantrayāmāsa
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the Bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi:

analyzed: ayam mahāsatvaḥ mahādevaḥ devādhipatiḥ na utthāpitaḥ
translated: This great being, the great god, the lord of gods, has not been revived.🔽What is the use of killing him?

analyzed: tat kim asya jīvita vipraṇāśena kṛtena  jīvāpaya enam
translated: Revive him.

analyzed: sat puruṣaḥ iyam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: He will become a good man.

original: atha vajrapāṇir evamastv iti kṛtvedaṃ mṛta saṃjīvanahṛdayamudājahāra vajrāyuḥ //
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ evam astu iti kṛtvā idam mṛta saṃjīvana hṛdayam udājahāra vajra āyuḥ
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, having agreed, saying So be it, uttered this heart mantra for reviving the dead: Vajrāyuḥ.

original: athāsmin bhāṣitamātre mahādevo devo mṛtaḥ saṃjīvyotthātumicchati /
analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātre mahādevaḥ devaḥ mṛtaḥ saṃjīvya utthātum icchati
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, the dead god Maheśvara desired to rise up, having been revived.

analyzed: na śaktaḥ vyutthātum
translated: But he was unable to rise up.

analyzed: tatas bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then he said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: kim aham bhagavatā evam śāsyāmi
translated: How am I instructed by the Blessed One?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: na tvam pratipadyasva asya mahāsat puruṣasya ājñām kartu
translated: You should not disobey the command of this great good man.

analyzed: ayam eva tena śāsti na aham
translated: He alone is the teacher, not me.

analyzed: maheśvaraḥ prāha
translated: Maheśvara said:

analyzed: kin na tvam bhagavan śaktaḥ usmāt dṛṣṭa satvān paritrātum iti
translated: Why can't you, Blessed One, protect these beings from this?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: na aham asmāt samarthaḥ paritrātum
translated: I am not able to protect them from this.

analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

analyzed: sarva tathāgata adhipati tvāt
translated: Because of being the lord of all tathāgatas.

analyzed: āha
translated: He said:

analyzed: na aham bhagavant bhagavataḥ bhāṣitasya artham ājāne
translated: Blessed One, I do not understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said.

original: kintu yatra hi nāma tathāgatānāmapi sarvatraidhātukādhipatīnāmanyo'dhipatistanna jāne ko'yam iti //
analyzed: kintu yatra hi nāma tathāgatānām api sarva traidhātuka adhipatīnām anyaḥ adhipatiḥ tat na jāne kaḥ ayam iti
translated: But since there is another lord over the tathāgatas, the lords of the entire three realms, I do not know who this is.

analyzed: atha bhagavān vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ punar api mahādevam āhūya evam āha
translated: Then the Blessed Vajrapāṇi, the great bodhisattva, again calling out to Mahādeva, said this:

original: na pratipadyasi kiṃ duṣṭasatva mamājñāṅkartum / iti /
analyzed: na pratipadyasi kim duṣṭa satva mama ājñām kartum iti
translated: Do you not accept to carry out my command, evil being?

original: atha mahādevo vajrasatvavacanamupaśrutya kupitaścaṇḍībhūtastathā patita eva punarapi mahāraudrarūpatāṃ darśayannevamāha /
analyzed: atha mahādevaḥ vajra satva vacanam upaśrutya kupitaḥ caṇḍībhūtaḥ tathā patitaḥ eva punar api mahā raudra rūpa tām darśayan evam āha
translated: Then Mahādeva, having heard the words of Vajrasattva, became angry and fierce, and while still fallen, again displaying a very wrathful form, said this:

analyzed: maraṇam api utsahāmi
translated: I am willing to die.

analyzed: na ca tava ājñām kariṣyāmi
translated: But I will not carry out your command.

original: atha vajrapāṇirmahābodhisatvo mahākopatāṃ sandarśayansvakramatālādida manuca ran niścacāra oṃ pādākarṣaṇa vajra hūṃ //
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ mahā kopa tām sandarśayan sva krama tālāt ida niścacāra om pāda ākarṣaṇa vajra hūm
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, displaying great wrath, uttered this mantra from his own lineage: Oṃ, draw the feet, vajra, hūṃ.

original: atha bhagavataścaraṇatālātsamantajvālā garbhākṛtabhrukuṭīdaṃṣṭrākarālamahāvaktro vajrā nucaro bhagavato vajrapā ṇeḥ purataḥ sthitvājñāṃ mārgayāmāsa
analyzed: atha bhagavataḥ caraṇa tālāt samanta jvālā garbha ākṛta bhrukuṭī daṃṣṭrā karāla mahā vaktraḥ vajrā nucaraḥ bhagavataḥ vajrapāḥ ṇeḥ puratas sthitvā ājñām mārgayāmāsa
translated: Then from the soles of the Blessed One's feet, a terrifying great face with eyes blazing all around, with knitted brow and fangs bared, the vajra follower, emerged in front of the Blessed Vajrapāṇi and requested his command.

original: atha vajrāpāṇirmaheśvarasaṃśodhananimittamevamāha oṃ pādākarṣākarṣasya sarvavajradharānucara kaṇḍa kaṇḍa va jra hūṃ jaḥ //
analyzed: atha vajrāpāṇiḥ maheśvara saṃśodhana nimittam evam āha om pāda ākarṣa ākarṣasya sarva vajradhara anucara kaṇḍa kaṇḍa va jra hūm jaḥ
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi, for the sake of purifying Maheśvara, said this: Oṃ, draw the feet, draw the feet of all vajra-holders, kaṇḍa kaṇḍa, vajra hūṃ jaḥ.

original: athaivamukte mahādeva umādevīsahitaḥ ūrdhvapādo nagnaḥ sarvajagadbhirupahasyamānaḥ pādākarṣaṇavajrānucareṇa bhagava to vajrapāṇeḥ purataḥ pādatāle sthāpita iti /
analyzed: atha evam ukte mahādevaḥ umā devī sahitaḥ ūrdhva pādaḥ nagnaḥ sarva jagadbhiḥ upahasyamānaḥ pāda ākarṣaṇa vajra anucareṇa bhagava taḥ vajrapāṇeḥ puratas pāda tāle sthāpitaḥ iti
translated: Then, when this was said, Mahādeva, with his feet up, naked, ridiculed by all the world, was placed by the vajra follower who draws the feet in front of the Blessed Vajrapāṇi at the soles of his feet.

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ bodhisatvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi said this to the Blessed One:

original: ayaṃ bhagavan duṣṭasatvaḥ sapatnīkaḥ kiṃ karomi / iti /
analyzed: ayam bhagavan duṣṭa satvaḥ sa patnīkaḥ kim karomi iti
translated: Blessed One, what should I do with this wicked being and his wife?

analyzed: bhagavān āha om vajra ākrama hoḥ
translated: The Blessed One said: Oṃ, vajra-conquer, hoḥ.

analyzed: atha evam ukte vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ mahādevam vāma pāda ākrāntam kṛtvā
translated: Then, when this was said, Vajrapāṇi, the great bodhisattva, having placed Mahādeva under his left foot,

original: dakṣiṇena comā yāḥ stanau pīḍayannidaṃ svahṛdayamudājahāra oṃ vajrāviśa hanaya traṃ traṭ //
analyzed: dakṣiṇena ca umāḥ yāḥ stanau pīḍayan idam sva hṛdayam udājahāra om vajra āviśa hanaya traṃ traṭ
translated: and with his right foot pressing on Umā's breasts, uttered this essence of his heart: Oṃ vajrāviśa hana traṃ traṭ.

analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātre mahādevaḥ samāviṣṭvā
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, Mahādeva became possessed.

analyzed: sva kara sahasreṇa mukha sahastram ahanat
translated: With his thousand hands he struck his thousand faces.

analyzed: atha vajra maṇi ratna śikhara kūṭāgārasya bāhyatas sarva tribhuvanaiḥ mahā nādaḥ muktaḥ
translated: Then, outside the vajra jewel peak palace, a great cry was released by all the three worlds:

analyzed: ayam saḥ usmākam adhipatiḥ anena mahātmanā śāsyate iti
translated: This is our lord, being punished by this great being.

analyzed: atha bhagavān mahādevasya upari mahā karuṇām utpādya
translated: Then the Blessed One, having generated great compassion above Mahādeva,

original: idaṃ sarvabuddhamaitrīhṛdayamabhāṣat oṃ buddha maitrī vajra rakṣa haṃ //
analyzed: idam sarva buddha maitrī hṛdayam abhāṣat om buddha maitrī vajra rakṣa haṃ
translated: spoke this essence of the love of all the Buddhas: Oṃ buddha maitrī vajra rakṣa haṃ.

analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātre mahādevasya tad āveśa duḥkham upaśāntam
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, Mahādeva's suffering of possession was pacified.

original: tacca vajrapāṇipādatalasparśamanuttarasiddhyabhiṣekasamādhivimokṣadhāraṇī jñānābhijñāvāptaye yāvat tathāgatatvāya saṃvṛtta iti /

translated: Then, as soon as this was said, all the mandalas from all around gathered on the peak of Mount Sumeru, surrounding it.

analyzed: atha bhagavān vajrapāṇiḥ tām sarva maṇḍala sanniveśān āhūya evam āha
translated: Then the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi, having summoned all those assembled in the mandala, said this:

analyzed: pratipadyata mārṣāḥ prāṇa atipāta vaira maṇya samaya saṃgrahaṇam iti
translated: Take up the vow of abstention from killing, friends.

analyzed: atha taiḥ bāhya maṇḍala samaya satvaiḥ bhagavām
translated: Then those beings of the outer mandala assembly requested the Blessed One:

original: vayaṃ bhagavan mānsāhārā dṛṣṭasatvatayā ojohāreṇa jīvikāṃ kalpayāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam bhagavat mānsa āhārāḥ dṛṣṭa satva tayā ojaḥ hāreṇa jīvikām kalpayāmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, we subsist on flesh and consume the vital essence of beings we see.

analyzed: tat ājñāpayatu bhagavān katham asmābhiḥ jīvitavyam iti
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, instruct us how we should live.

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ imam duṣṭa vajra krodham abhāṣat
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi spoke this wicked vajra wrath:

original: oṃ duṣṭavajrakrodha hana daha paca vidhvaṃsaya vikira sarvaduṣṭasamayamudrāmaṇḍalān bhaṃja bhaṃja marda marda khāda khāda paramantrān vajra samaya huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: om duṣṭa vajra krodha hana daha paca vidhvaṃsaya vikira sarva duṣṭa samaya mudrā maṇḍalān bhaṃja bhaṃja marda marda khāda khāda para mantrān vajra samaya hum phaṭ
translated: Om! O angry Vajra, kill, burn, cook, destroy, scatter all evil samaya mudra mandalas! Break, break! Crush, crush! Eat, eat the supreme mantras! Vajra samaya hum phat!
The Vajra and angry fingers are properly joined and wrapped.

analyzed: sandhayet mukhataḥ gāḍhām mudrā iyam duṣṭa nāśanī ti
translated: One should firmly join them at the mouth. This mudra destroys the evil.

original: athāsmin bhāṣitamātre sarvaduṣṭamaṇḍalāni ekadhyībhūtvānekāni vidhvansitāni vikīrṇāni /
analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātre sarva duṣṭa maṇḍalāni ekadhyībhūtvā anekāni vidhvansitāni vikīrṇāni
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, all the evil mandalas became one and were destroyed and scattered.

analyzed: samaya mudrā bandhāḥ sphoṭitāḥ
translated: The samaya mudra bonds were shattered.

original: te ca duṣṭasamayasatvā dahyamānāḥ pacyamānā mahānto mahārauravāntāntān khān muñcanto /
analyzed: te ca duṣṭa samaya satvāḥ dahyamānāḥ pacyamānāḥ mahāntaḥ mahāraurava anta antān khāt muñcantaḥ
translated: And those evil samaya beings, being burned and cooked, let out great cries from the deepest hells.

analyzed: yena bhagavān mahā vajra dharaḥ tena añjalayaḥ badhvā evam āhuḥ
translated: Bowing with joined palms in the direction of the Blessed One, the Great Vajra Holder, they said this:

analyzed: paritrāyasva bhagavan
translated: Save us, Blessed One!

analyzed: yena vayam prāṇān na parityajāmaḥ
translated: So that we may not give up our lives!

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ punar api bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then Vajrapani again said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: ājñāpayasva bhagavan katham eṣām duṣṭa maṇḍalānām pratipadyāmi
translated: Instruct us, Blessed One, how we should deal with these evil mandalas.

original: atha bhagavānidamuvāca oṃ nisuṃbha hana daha paca gṛhṇa bandha huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha bhagavān idam uvāca om nisuṃbha hana daha paca gṛhṇa bandha hum phaṭ
translated: Then the Blessed One said this: Om, Nisumbha, kill, burn, cook, seize, bind, hum phat!

original: atha vajrapāṇirmahābodhisatva imaṃ vajrakrūrakrodhamabhāṣat oṃ mahāvajrakrūrakrodha pātaya sarvaduṣṭamaṇḍalān /
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ imam vajra krūra krodham abhāṣat om mahā vajra krūra krodha pātaya sarva duṣṭa maṇḍalān
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapani spoke this vajra-cruel wrath: Om, great vajra-cruel wrath, bring down all the evil maṇḍalas!

analyzed: vināśaya sarva duṣṭa samayān
translated: Destroy all the evil samaya!

analyzed: vikira vidhvaṃsaya sphoṭaya bhaṃjaya sarva duṣṭa samaya mudrā bandhān
translated: Scatter, destroy, burst, break all the evil samaya seals and bonds!

original: gṛh ṇa hana daha paca sarvaduṣṭasamayasatvān /
analyzed: gṛh na hana daha paca sarva duṣṭa samaya satvān
translated: Seize, kill, burn, cook all the evil samaya beings!

analyzed: vajra samaya hum phaṭ
translated: Vajra samaya hum phat!

original: athāsmin bhāṣitamātre sarvaduṣṭasamayamudrāmaṇḍalāni punarapyekadhyībhūtvā mahāsāgare prapatitānīti //
analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātre sarva duṣṭa samaya mudrā maṇḍalāni punar api ekadhyībhūtvā mahā sāgare prapatitāni iti
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, all the evil samaya seals and maṇḍalas became one mass again and fell into the great ocean.

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ punar api bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapani said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: aham bhagavatā sarva duṣṭa damanāya adhyeṣitaḥ
translated: Blessed One, I have been commanded by you to subdue all the evil ones.

analyzed: tat eṣām ḍākinī graha ādīnām sarva grahāṇām katham pratipadyāmi
translated: Then how should I deal with these ḍākinī grahas and all the other grahas?

original: atha bhagavānidamavocat oṃ hana hana vajra huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha bhagavān idam avocat om hana hana vajra hum phaṭ
translated: Then the Blessed One said this: Om, kill, kill, vajra, hum phat!

original: atha vajrapāṇirmahābodhisatvaḥ punarapi sarvaḍākinyādiduṣṭagrahākarṣaṇahṛdayamabhāṣat oṃ vajrākarṣaya śīghraṃ sarvaduṣṭagrahān vajradharasatyena huṃ jaḥ //
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ punar api sarva ḍākinī ādi duṣṭa graha ākarṣaṇa hṛdayam abhāṣat om vajra ākarṣaya śīghram sarva duṣṭa grahān vajradhara satyena hum jaḥ
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi again spoke the heart mantra for summoning all the evil grahas such as the ḍākinīs: Om! Vajra, quickly summon all the evil grahas! By the truth of the vajra-holder, hum jh!

original: athāsmin bhāṣitamātre ḍākinyādayaḥ sarvaduṣṭagrahāḥ sumerugirimūrdhni bāhyato maṇḍalībhūtvāvasthitā iti //
analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātre ḍākinī ādayaḥ sarva duṣṭa grahāḥ sumeru giri mūrdhni bāhyatas maṇḍalībhūtvā avasthitāḥ iti
translated: As soon as this was spoken, all the evil grahas such as the ḍākinīs gathered externally on the peak of Mount Sumeru, forming a circle, and remained there.

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ tām ḍākinī ādīn sarva duṣṭa grahān āhūya evam āha
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi summoned those ḍākinīs and all the evil grahas, and said this:

analyzed: pratipadyata mārṣāḥ prāṇa atipāta vaira maṇya śikṣā samaya saṃvare
translated: Accept, sirs, the training in refraining from taking life, and the vow of discipline.

original: mā vo vajreṇādīptena pradīptenaikajvālībhūtena kulāni nirdaheyam /
analyzed: mā vaḥ vajreṇa ādīptena pradīptena eka jvālībhūtena kulāni nirdaheyam
translated: Do not let me burn your families with a blazing vajra, blazing and turned into a single flame.

original: atha te ḍākinyādayaḥ sarvaduṣṭagrahā yena bhagavān tenāñjalim badhvā bhagavantaṃ vijñāpayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: atha te ḍākinī ādayaḥ sarva duṣṭa grahāḥ yena bhagavān tena añjalim badhvā bhagavantam vijñāpayāmāsuḥ
translated: Then those ḍākinīs and all the evil grahas, with palms joined, addressed the Blessed One:

analyzed: vayam bhagavat mānsa āśinaḥ
translated: Blessed One, we eat flesh.

analyzed: tat ājñāpayasva katham pratipattavyam iti
translated: Therefore, instruct us how to practice.

original: atha bhagavān vajrapāṇimevamāha pratipadyasva vajrapāṇe eṣāṃ sarvānāṃ mahākaruṇāmutpādyopāyandātum iti /
analyzed: atha bhagavān vajrapāṇim evam āha pratipadyasva vajrapāṇe eṣām sarvānām mahā karuṇām utpādya upāyan dātum iti
translated: Then the Blessed One said to Vajrapāṇi, Vajrapāṇi, accept this method of giving, having generated great compassion for all of them.

original: atha vajrapāṇirmahākāruṇika idaṃ sarvasatvamaraṇanimittajñānamudrāhṛdayamabhāṣat oṃ vajra pratigṛhaṇa hṛdayamākarṣaya /
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā kāruṇikaḥ idam sarva satva maraṇa nimitta jñāna mudrā hṛdayam abhāṣat om vajra pratigṛhaṇa hṛdayam ākarṣaya
translated: Then the greatly compassionate Vajrapāṇi spoke this heart of the knowledge mudrā of the signs of death of all beings: Om Vajra, accept the heart, draw it in.

analyzed: yadi ayam satvaḥ māṃsa āda tvena mriyate
translated: If this being is to die by being eaten,

analyzed: tat asya hṛdayat niṣkramatu
translated: then let his heart come out.

analyzed: samaya hum jjaḥ
translated: Samaya hum jjaḥ.

original: athāsya mudrābandho bhavati /🔽vajrabandhaṃ samādhāya bāhubhyāṃ suhṛdaṃ hṛdi /
analyzed: atha asya mudrābandhaḥ bhavati  vajra bandham samādhāya bāhubhyām suhṛdam hṛdi
translated: Then the binding of his mudrā is as follows:🔽Having formed the vajra bond with the arms at the heart,

analyzed: vajra aṅguli mukhābhyām tu sva kakṣau tu samutkarṣet iti
translated: with the vajra fingers facing each other, one should raise one's armpits.

analyzed: anayā mudrayā bhavadbhiḥ sarva satva hṛdayāni apakṛṣya bhoktavyāni iti
translated: With this mudrā, you should pull out the hearts of all beings and eat them.

original: atha te ḍākinyādayaḥ sarvaduṣṭagrahā huluhuluprakṣveḍitāni kṛtvā svabhavanaṃ gatā iti //
analyzed: atha te ḍākinī ādayaḥ sarva duṣṭa grahāḥ huluhulu prakṣveḍitāni kṛtvā sva bhavanam gatāḥ iti
translated: Then those ḍākinīs and all the evil grahas, having made the sound hulu hulu, went to their own abodes.

analyzed: atha bhagavān vajrapāṇiḥ punar api bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed Vajrapāṇi said this again to the Blessed One:

original: ahaṃ bhagavadbhiḥ sarvatathāgataiḥ sarvaduṣṭadamaka iti kṛtvādhyiṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: aham bhagavadbhiḥ sarva tathāgataiḥ sarva duṣṭa damakaḥ iti kṛtvā adhyiṣṭaḥ
translated: I have been commanded by the Blessed Ones, all the Tathagatas, to be the subduer of all evildoers.

original: tadājñāpayatu me bhagavān jvarādīnāṃ vyādhīnāṃ kiṅkaromi / /
analyzed: tat ājñāpayatu me bhagavān jvara ādīnām vyādhīnām kiṅkaromi
translated: Therefore, may the Blessed One command me: What shall I do for the diseases beginning with fever?

analyzed: atha bhagavān āha om hum phaṭ
translated: Then the Blessed One said, Om hum phat.

original: atha vajrapāṇirmahābodhisatvaḥ sarvajvarādyākarṣaṇahṛdayamudājahāra oṃ vajra samayānaya sarvaduṣṭajvarādīnnāśayaṃ huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ sarva jvara ādi ākarṣaṇa hṛdayam udājahāra om vajra samayā ānaya sarva duṣṭa jvara ādīn nāśayam hum phaṭ
translated: Then the great Bodhisattva Vajrapani uttered the heart for summoning all fevers and so forth: Om vajra, summon all evil fevers and so forth, destroy them, hum phat.

original: athāsmin bhāṣitamātre jvarādayaḥ sarve sumerugirimūrdhni bāhyataḥ parivāryavasthitā abhūvan /
analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātre jvara ādayaḥ sarve sumeru giri mūrdhni bāhyatas parivārya avasthitāḥ abhūvan
translated: As soon as this was spoken, all fevers and so forth were gathered outside on the peak of Mount Sumeru.

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ tān jvara ādīn āhūya evam āha
translated: Then Vajrapani summoned those fevers and so forth and said this:

analyzed: pratipadyata mārṣāḥ satva upaghāta vaira maṇya śikṣā grahaṇa saṃvare
translated: Accept, friends, the vow of restraint from harming beings and taking up the precepts.

original: atha ta evamāhu /🔽vayaṃ bhagavan satvau jo'pahṛtya jīvikāṃ kalpayāmaḥ /
analyzed: atha te evam āhu  vayam bhagavan satvau jā upahṛtya jīvikām kalpayāmaḥ
translated: Then they said this:🔽Blessed One, we make a living by harming beings.

analyzed: tat sādhu bhagavān ājñāpayatu katham pratipadyāmahe iti
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, it would be good if you would command us how we should proceed.

original: atha vajrapāṇirmahābodhisatva idaṃ svakarmaviśuddhijñānamudrāhṛdayamudājahāra oṃ vajrakarma viśodhaya sarvāvaraṇāni buddhasatyena samaya hūṃ
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ idam sva karma viśuddhi jñāna mudrā hṛdayam udājahāra om vajra karma viśodhaya sarva āvaraṇāni buddha satyena samaya hūm
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi proclaimed this essence of the knowledge-mudrā of his own purified activity: Om, purify the vajra activity, all obscurations, by the truth of the Buddha, samayâh hûṃ.

analyzed: atha asya mudrābandhaḥ bhavati
translated: Then, the binding of this mudrā is as follows:

analyzed: vajra añjalim dṛḍhīkṛtya tarjanī dvaya kuñcitām
translated: Having firmly made the vajra-clasp, the two index fingers are bent,

analyzed: su bandhita sama aṅguṣṭhya yantritā pāpa hāriṇī iti
translated: And the thumbs are well-bound and controlled, removing evil.

original: iyaṃ mudrā yasya jvarādisarvavyādhispṛṣṭasya karmato darśayet /
analyzed: iyam mudrā yasya jvara ādi sarva vyādhi spṛṣṭasya karmataḥ darśayet
translated: This mudrā, if shown by the one who is afflicted by all illnesses such as fever and so forth,

analyzed: tat yuṣmābhiḥ apasartavyam
translated: You should depart from there.

analyzed: mā vaḥ jīvita nāśaḥ bhavet iti
translated: Do not destroy your own life.

original: atha ta evamastv iti kṛtvā prakrāntā iti //
analyzed: atha te evam astu iti kṛtvā prakrāntāḥ iti
translated: Then, having agreed, So be it, they departed.

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ sarva tathāgatān evam āha
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi said this to all the tathāgatas:

analyzed: aham bhagavadbhiḥ sarva āvaraṇa nīvaraṇa karma āvaraṇa viśuddhi hetoḥ sva hṛdayebhyaḥ viniḥsṛṣṭaḥ
translated: I was emitted from your hearts by the Blessed Ones for the sake of purifying all obscurations, hindrances, and karmic obscurations.

original: tadājñāpayatu me bhagavantaḥ eṣānnarakādīnāṃ sarvāpāyānāṃ kathaṃ pratipattavyam iti /
analyzed: tat ājñāpayatu me bhagavantaḥ eṣān naraka ādīnām sarva apāyānām katham pratipattavyam iti
translated: Therefore, may the Blessed Ones command me as to how I should proceed regarding these hells and all the other lower realms.

analyzed: bhagavān āha om kṣapaya vajra svāhā
translated: The Blessed One said, Om, destroy with the vajra, svâhâ!

original: atha vajrapāṇirmahābodhisatvaḥ rauravādisarvāpāyagaticakrākarṣaṇahṛdamabhāṣat oṃ sarvāpāyakarṣaṇa viśodhana vajrasamaya huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ raurava ādi sarva apāya gati cakra ākarṣaṇa hṛdam abhāṣat om sarva apāya karṣaṇa viśodhana vajra samaya hum phaṭ
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi spoke the heart mantra for drawing all the beings of the hells and other unfortunate destinies, such as the Raurava hell, and so forth: Om, draw all unfortunate destinies, purify, vajra pledge, hūṃ phaṭ!

original: athāsmin bhāṣitamātre rauravamahārauravādayaḥ sarvāpāyasanniveśāḥ sumerugirimurdhni bāhyataḥ parivāryāvasthitāḥ /
analyzed: atha asmin bhāṣita mātre raurava mahāraurava ādayaḥ sarva āpāya sanniveśāḥ sumeru giri murdhni bāhyatas parivārya avasthitāḥ
translated: Then, as soon as this was spoken, the great hells Raurava, Mahāraurava, and all the abodes of misfortune, were situated externally, surrounding the peak of Mount Sumeru.

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisatvaḥ tān apāya bhūmi patitān sarva satvān āhūya evam āha
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, having summoned all those beings fallen into the realms of misfortune, spoke thus:

analyzed: gṛhṇata mārṣāḥ triśaraṇa gamana saṅkaṭāt
translated: Take refuge, friends, in the Three Jewels, which are free from danger!

original: eṣa vayaṃ buddhaṃ dharma saṃghaṃ tvaṃ ca śaraṇaṃ gacchāma iti /
analyzed: eṣa vayam buddham dharma saṃgham tvam ca śaraṇam gacchāma iti
translated: We go for refuge to the Buddha, the Dharma, the Saṅgha, and you.

original: atha vajrapāṇiḥ sarvāpāyasphoṭanahṛdayamudājahāra oṃ vajrapāṇi visphoṭaya sarvāpāyabandhanāni pramokṣaya sarvāpāyagatibhya sarvasatvān sarvatathāgatavajra samaya traṭ //
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ sarva apāya sphoṭana hṛdayam udājahāra om vajrapāṇi visphoṭaya sarva apāya bandhanāni pramokṣaya sarva apāya gatibhyaḥ sarva satvān sarva tathāgata vajra samaya traṭ
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi proclaimed the heart mantra for shattering all unfortunate destinies: Om, Vajrapāṇi, shatter all the bonds of unfortunate destinies, liberate all beings from all unfortunate destinies, all tathāgatas' vajra pledge, traṭ!

analyzed: atha asya mudrābandhaḥ bhavati
translated: Then the binding of its mudrā is as follows:

analyzed: vajra bandham dṛḍhīkṛtya madhyamā dvaya sandhi tā
translated: Having firmly made the vajra bond, the two middle fingers are joined,🔽and the two index fingers are raised like a spear.

analyzed: catur antya mukha āsaktā pāpasphoṭā iti kīrtitā
translated: Attached to the four corners and the mouth, it is known as the Pāpasphoṭa.

original: atha te tryapāyagaticakrāntarasthitāḥ sarvasatvā vajrapāṇisakāśādimāṃ mudrāṃ dṛṣṭvā /
analyzed: atha te tri apāya gati cakra antara sthitāḥ sarva satvāḥ vajrapāṇi sakāśāt imām mudrām dṛṣṭvā
translated: Then all beings dwelling in the intermediate directions of the wheel of the three lower realms, having seen this mudrā in the presence of Vajrapāṇi,

analyzed: sarva durgatibhyaḥ cyutvā
translated: having fallen from all lower realms,

analyzed: bhagavataḥ vairocanasya pāda mūle upapannāḥ
translated: were reborn at the feet of the Blessed One Vairocana.

analyzed: te cāpāyāḥ mahā samudre patitāḥ iti
translated: And those lower realms fell into the great ocean.

analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ mahā bodhisattvaḥ punar api bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the great bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi again said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: aham bhagavan aśeṣa anavaśeṣa tva dhātu paritrāṇa sarva hita sukha anubhavana artha yāvat sarva tathāgata tva uttama siddhi phala avāpti hetoḥ sarva tathāgata siddhi vajram
translated: Blessed One, for the sake of protecting the entire realm of beings without exception, for the sake of experiencing all benefit and happiness, up to the attainment of the fruit of the supreme accomplishment of all tathāgatas, I, Vajrapāṇi,

analyzed: sarva tathāgataiḥ adhyiṣṭaḥ
translated: have been commanded by all the tathāgatas.

original: tatsādhu ājñāpayantu me bhagavantaḥ sarvatathāgatā athaiṣāṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ kiṅkaromī ti /
analyzed: tat sādhu ājñāpayantu me bhagavantaḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ atha eṣām manuṣyāṇām kiṅkaromi iti
translated: Therefore, Blessed Ones, all tathāgatas, please command me. What shall I do for these humans?

original: punarapi bhagavato vajrapāṇermūdham anupariveṣṭitāḥ /🔽sarvatathāgatoṣṇīṣatejorāśiṃ bhūtvā sthitaḥ /
analyzed: punar api bhagavataḥ vajrapāṇeḥ mūdham anupariveṣṭitāḥ  sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa tejaḥ rāśim bhūtvā sthitaḥ
translated: Again, he completely surrounded the head of the Blessed Vajrapāṇi.🔽Becoming the mass of splendor of the Uṣṇīṣa of all the Tathāgatas, he remained there.

analyzed: atha tatas tejaḥ rāśitaḥ idam sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣam niścacāra
translated: Then from that mass of splendor, this Uṣṇīṣa of all the Tathāgatas emerged:

original: oṃ namassarvatathāgatoṣṇīṣa tejorāśi anavalokitamūrdha hūṃ jvāla dhaka vidhaka dara vidara huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: om namaḥ sarva tathāgata uṣṇīṣa tejaḥ rāśi anavalokita mūrdha hūm jvāla dhaka vidhaka dara vidara hum phaṭ
translated: Oṃ, homage to the uṣṇīṣa of all tathāgatas, mass of light, invisible crown, huṃ jvāla dha ka vidha ka da ra vi da ra huṃ phaṭ.

original: atha vajrapāṇirbodhisatvo mahāsatva idaṃ svavidyottamamudājahāraoṃ nisuṃbha vajra huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajrapāṇiḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ idam sva vidyā uttamam udājahāra om nisuṃbha vajra hum phaṭ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajrapāṇi uttered his own supreme vidyā: Oṃ niṣuṃbha vajra huṃ phaṭ.

original: tataḥ punarapi vajrapāṇiḥ svahṛdayādidaṃ hṛdayamudājahāra oṃ ṭṭakki jjaḥ //🔽atha vajragarbho bodhisatvo mahāsatva idaṃ svavidyottamamabhāṣat oṃ vajra ratnottama jvālaya huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: tatas punar api vajrapāṇiḥ sva hṛdayāt idam hṛdayam udājahāra om ṭṭakki jjaḥ  atha vajragarbhaḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ idam sva vidyā uttamam abhāṣat om vajra ratna uttama jvālaya hum phaṭ
translated: Then Vajrapāṇi again uttered this heart from his own heart: Oṃ ṭṭakki jaḥ.🔽Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajragarbha spoke this supreme vidyā of his own: Oṃ vajra ratnottama jvālaya huṃ phaṭ.

original: atha vajranetro bodhisatvo mahāsatva idaṃ svavidyottamamabhāṣat oṃ svabhāvaśuddha vajrapadma śodhaya sarvān vidyottama huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajranetraḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ idam sva vidyā uttamam abhāṣat om svabhāva śuddha vajrapadma śodhaya sarvān vidyā uttama hum phaṭ
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Vajranetra spoke this supreme vidyā of his own: Oṃ svabhāvaśuddha vajrapadma śodhaya sarvān vidyottama huṃ phaṭ.

original: atha vajraviśvo bodhisattvo mahāsatva imaṃ svavidyottamamabhāṣat oṃ vajrakarmottama vajradhara samayamanusmara suṃbhanisuṃbhākarṣaya praveśayāveśaya bandhaya samayaṃ grahaya sarvakarmāṇi me kuru mahāsatva huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajraviśvaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ imam sva vidyā uttamam abhāṣat om vajra karma uttama vajradhara samayam anusmara suṃbha nisuṃbha ākarṣaya praveśaya āveśaya bandhaya samayam grahaya sarva karmāṇi me kuru mahāsatva hum phaṭ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Vajraviśva, the Great Being, brought forth this best of his own vidyā: “Oṃ, O Vajrakarma, O supreme one, O Vajradhara, remember your samaya, summon, summon, draw in, draw in, possess, possess, bind, bind, remember the samaya, perform all actions for me, O Great Being, huṃ phaṭ!”

original: atha vajravidyottamo bodhisatvo mahāsatva idaṃ svahṛdayaṃ bhagavato vajrapāṇeḥ pādavandanīyaṃ niryātayāmāsa oṃ suṃbha nisuṃbha vajravidyottama huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajravidyottamaḥ bodhisatvaḥ mahāsatvaḥ idam sva hṛdayam bhagavataḥ vajrapāṇeḥ pāda vandanīyam niryātayāmāsa om suṃbha nisuṃbha vajra vidyā uttama hum phaṭ
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Vajravidyottama, the Great Being, offered this heart of his to the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi, bowing at his feet: “Oṃ, O Suṃbha, O Niṃbha, O Vajravidyottama, huṃ phaṭ!”

original: atha krodhavajro vidyārājo bhagavataścaraṇayornipatyeda svahṛdayamadāt huṃ vajraśūla //
analyzed: atha krodhavajraḥ vidyārājaḥ bhagavataḥ caraṇayoḥ nipatya idam sva hṛdayam adāt hum vajraśūla
translated: Then the Wrathful Vajra, the King of Vidyās, having bowed at the feet of the Blessed One, gave this his own heart: “Huṃ, O Vajra-spear!”

original: atha māyāvajro vidyārājedaṃ svahṛdayamabhāṣat oṃ vajramāya vidarśaya sarva huṃ phaṭ //🔽atha vajraghaṇṭo vidyārājaḥ svahṛdayamadāt oṃ vajraghaṇṭa raṇa raṇa huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha māyāvajraḥ vidyārāja idam sva hṛdayam abhāṣat om vajramāya vidarśaya sarva hum phaṭ  atha vajraghaṇṭaḥ vidyārājaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt om vajraghaṇṭa raṇa raṇa hum phaṭ
translated: Then the Illusion Vajra, the King of Vidyās, spoke this his own heart: “Oṃ, O Vajra-illusion, display all, huṃ phaṭ!”🔽Then the Vajra-bell, the King of Vidyās, gave this his own heart: “Oṃ, O Vajra-bell, ring, ring, huṃ phaṭ!”

original: atha maunavajraḥ svahṛdayamadāt oṃ vajramauna mahāvrata huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha maunavajraḥ sva hṛdayam adāt om vajra mauna mahāvrata hum phaṭ
translated: Then the Silent Vajra gave this his own heart: “Oṃ, O Silent Vajra, great vow, huṃ phaṭ!”

original: atha vajrāyudhaḥ svahṛdayamadāt oṃ vajrāyudha dāmaka huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: atha vajrāyudhaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt om vajrāyudha dāmaka hum phaṭ
translated: Then Vajrāyudha gave his heart: “Oṃ vajrāyudha dāmaka hūṃ phaṭ.”

analyzed: vidyārājanakāḥ
translated: The vidyārāja-like ones.

original: atha vajrakuṇḍalirvajrakrodho bhagavate vajrapāṇaye idaṃ svahṛdayaṃ pādavandanīyaṃ niryātayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha vajra kuṇḍaliḥ vajra krodhaḥ bhagavate vajrapāṇaye idam sva hṛdayam pāda vandanīyam niryātayāmāsa
translated: Then Vajrakuṇḍali, the vajra wrathful one, offered this heart of his, to be bowed to at the feet, to the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi:

original: oṃ vajrakuṇḍali mahāvajrakrodha guhṇa hana daha paca vidhvaṃsaya /
analyzed: om vajrakuṇḍali mahā vajra krodha guhṇa hana daha paca vidhvaṃsaya
translated: “Oṃ vajrakuṇḍali mahāvajra-krodha guha han daha pacavidhvaṃsaya.

original: vajreṇa mūrdhānaṃ sphālaya bhinda hṛdayaṃ vajrakrodha huṃ phaṭ //
analyzed: vajreṇa mūrdhānam sphālaya bhinda hṛdayam vajra krodha hum phaṭ
translated: With the vajra, crush the head, break the heart, vajra wrathful one hūṃ phaṭ.”

analyzed: atha vajraprabhaḥ vajrakrodhaḥ idam sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajraprabha, the vajra wrathful one, gave this his heart:

analyzed: om vajraprabha māraya saumya krodha hum phaṭ
translated: “Oṃ vajraprabha māraya saumya-krodha hūṃ phaṭ.”

analyzed: atha vajradaṇḍaḥ vajra krodhaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajradaṇḍa, the vajra wrathful one, gave his heart:

analyzed: om vajradaṇḍa tanuya sarva duṣṭān mahā krodha hum phaṭ
translated: “Oṃ vajradaṇḍa tanu ya all evildoers mahā-krodha hūṃ phaṭ.”

analyzed: atha vajrapiṅgalaḥ vajra krodhaḥ idam sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajrapiṅgala, the vajra wrathful one, gave this his heart:

analyzed: om vajrapiṅgala bhīṣaya sarva duṣṭān bhīma krodha hum phaṭ
translated: “Oṃ vajrapiṅgala bhisaya all evildoers bhīma-krodha hūṃ phaṭ.”

analyzed: vajra krodhāḥ
translated: The vajra wrathful ones.

original: atha vajraśauṇḍo gaṇapatirbhagavate vajrapāṇaye idaṃ hṛdayanniryātayati sma /
analyzed: atha vajraśauṇḍaḥ gaṇapatiḥ bhagavate vajrapāṇaye idam hṛdayat niryātayati sma
translated: Then Vajraśauṇḍa, Lord of Ganas, offered this heart-mantra to the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi:

analyzed: atha vajramālaḥ idam sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajramāla offered his own heart:

analyzed: om vajramāla gaṇapataye mālayā ākarṣaya praveśaya āveśaya bandhaya vaśīkuru māraya hum phaṭ
translated: Oṃ, to Vajramāla, Lord of Ganas, with the garland, attract, lead in, possess, bind, enthrall, kill, hūṃ phaṭ!

analyzed: om vajravijaya vijayam kuru mahāgaṇapati hum phaṭ
translated: Oṃ, Vajra-vijaya, bring victory, Great Lord of Ganas, hūṃ phaṭ!

analyzed: om vajra musala kṛṭṭa kuṭṭa sarva duṣṭān vajradūta huṃ phaṭ

analyzed: om vajra anila mahā vega ānaya sarva duṣṭān hum phaṭ

analyzed: atha vajrabhairavaḥ dūtaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then the messenger Vajrabhairava gave his heart:

analyzed: om vajrabhairava vajradūta bhakṣaya sarva duṣṭān mahāyakṣa hum phaṭ
translated: Om Vajrabhairava, vajra messenger, devour all evildoers, great yakṣa, hum phat!

analyzed: dūtāḥ

analyzed: om vajraṅkuśa ākarṣaya sarva mahā ceṭa hum phaṭ

analyzed: atha vajrakālaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt
translated: Then Vajrakāla gave his heart:

analyzed: atha vajravināyakaḥ sva hṛdayam adāt

analyzed: om vajra vināyaka asya vighnam kuru hum phaṭ

analyzed: om nāga vajra ānaya sarva dhana dhānya hiraṇya suvarṇa maṇi muktā alaṅkāra ādīni sarva upakaraṇāni vajradhara samayam anusmara kaḍḍha gṛhṇa bandha hara hara prāṇān mahāceṭa hum phaṭ
translated: Oṃ, Nāga Vajra, bring all wealth, grain, silver, gold, jewels, pearls, ornaments, and so forth, all the requisites, remember the pledge, pull, seize, bind, take away, take away life, great servant, huṃ phaṭ!

analyzed: ceṭāḥ
