translated: Having seen the great mandala, one should make offerings of incense, flowers, lamps, and scents with the mudras.

analyzed: tatas vajra vācā jāpam ārabhyati
translated: Then, with the Vajra Speech, one should begin the recitation.

analyzed: tatra ayam jāpa vidhiḥ bhavati
translated: Here is the ritual procedure for the recitation:

analyzed: yathā sthāna sthitaḥ catur māsam catur sandhyam dhūpa ādibhiḥ yathāvat pūjām kṛtvā
translated: Having remained in the proper posture for four months, at the four junctions of the day, having made offerings as appropriate with incense and so forth,

analyzed: sarva tathāgata mahāyāna abhisamaya nāma aṣṭaśatena sarva tathāgatān abhiṣṭutya
translated: Having praised all the Tathagatas with the eight hundred names of the great vehicle of all the Tathagatas,

analyzed: catur mudrā praṇāma yogena praṇaman ātma niryātana pūjā kārī anena mantra catuṣṭayena
translated: Bowing with the yoga of the four mudras, one should make the offering of oneself with this set of four mantras.

original: oṃ sarvatathāgatapūjopasthānāyātmānaṃ niryātayāmi sarvatathāgatavajrasatvādhitiṣṭhasva māṃ //🔽oṃ sarvatathāgatapūjābhiṣekāyātmānaṃ niryātayāmi sarvatathāgatavajraratnābhiṣiñca māṃ //🔽oṃ sarvatathāgatapūjāpravartanāyātmānaṃ niryātayāmi sarvatathāgatavajradharma pravartaya māṃ //
analyzed: om sarva tathāgata pūjā upasthānāya ātmānam niryātayāmi sarva tathāgata vajra satva adhitiṣṭhasva mām  om sarva tathāgata pūjā abhiṣekāya ātmānam niryātayāmi sarva tathāgata vajra ratna abhiṣiñca mām  om sarva tathāgata pūjā pravartanāya ātmānam niryātayāmi sarva tathāgata vajra dharma pravartaya mām
translated: Om, I offer myself for the worship and service of all Tathagatas. O Vajrasattva of all Tathagatas, consecrate me!🔽Om, I offer myself for the consecration of worship of all Tathagatas. O Vajraratna of all Tathagatas, consecrate me!🔽Om, I offer myself for the performance of the worship of all Tathagatas. O Vajradharma of all Tathagatas, perform me!

original: oṃ sarvatathāgatapūjākarmaṇe ātmānaṃ niryātayāmi sarvatathāgatavajrakarma kuru māṃ //
analyzed: om sarva tathāgata pūjā karmaṇe ātmānam niryātayāmi sarva tathāgata vajra karma kuru mām
translated: Om, I offer myself for the action of worship of all Tathagatas. O Vajrakarma of all Tathagatas, perform me!

original: tato'viraktaḥ sarvakāmaguṇeṣu sarvāhāraḥ sarvakāmopabhogīhṛdayārthaḥ svamātmānaṃ buddhabimbaṃ purato vāṅmātreṇāpi bhāvayan yathākāmakaraṇīyatayā /
analyzed: tatas viraktaḥ sarva kāma guṇeṣu sarva āhāraḥ sarva kāma upabhogī hṛdaya arthaḥ svam ātmānam buddha bimbam puratas vāc mātreṇa api bhāvayan yathā kāma karaṇīya tayā
translated: Then, not detached from all desirable qualities, eating everything, enjoying all desires, contemplating one's own self as the Buddha's form in front, even with mere speech, as one who can do as one wishes.

original: aṣṭaśataṃ vajravācā japannāśu prasidhyatī tyāha bhagavān vajrasatvaḥ //
analyzed: aṣṭaśatam vajra vācā japan āśu prasidhyati iti āha bhagavān vajrasatvaḥ
translated: Reciting the vajra words one hundred and eight times, one will quickly succeed, said the Blessed One, Vajrasattva.

original: athottamasiddhimicchettataḥ paṭe bhagavantaṃ tathāgataṃ madhye lekhayet /
analyzed: atha uttama siddhim icchet tatas paṭe bhagavantam tathāgatam madhye lekhayet
translated: If one wishes for the supreme accomplishment, then one should draw the Blessed One, the Tathagata, in the center of the cloth.

original: tasya caturmahāsatvamaṇḍalayogena yathābhirucitavarṇābharaṇā mahāsatvāścandramaṇḍalapratiṣṭhitā lekhyāḥ koṇabhāgeṣu kuladevya iti /
analyzed: tasya catur mahāsatva maṇḍala yogena yathā abhirucita varṇa ābharaṇāḥ mahā satvāḥ candra maṇḍala pratiṣṭhitāḥ lekhyāḥ koṇa bhāgeṣu kula devyaḥ iti
translated: And in accordance with the mandala of the four great beings, the great beings of various colors and ornaments, established on moon discs, should be drawn in the corners, the family goddesses.

original: tataḥ paṭasyodārāṃ pūjāṃ kṛtvā yathāvajjapayogena tāvajjapet yāvanmāsacatuṣṭayaṃ /
analyzed: tatas paṭasya udārām pūjām kṛtvā yathāvat japa yogena tāvat japet yāvat māsa catuṣṭayam
translated: Then, having made extensive offerings to the cloth, one should recite the mantra as much as one can, in accordance with the method, for four months.

analyzed: tatas sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, one should recite throughout the entire night.

analyzed: tatas prabhāte sarva tathāgata tatva ādīn uttama siddhīn avāpnoti iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: Then, at dawn, one will attain the supreme accomplishments, such as the truth of all Tathagatas, said the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: athamudrāsādhanamicchettena sarvatathāgatasatvavajrimudrāṃ badhvā paṭasyāgrato vajravācāṃ śatasahasraṃ yathākāmakaraṇīyatayā yathāvad bandhan muñcaṃśca japet /
analyzed: atha mudrā sādhanam icchet tena sarva tathāgata satva vajri mudrām badhvā paṭasya agratas vajra vācām śata sahasram yathākāma karaṇīya tayā yathāvat bandhan muñcan ca japet
translated: If one wishes for the accomplishment of the mudras, then, having formed the mudra of all Tathagatas, Vajrasattva, in front of the cloth, one should recite the vajra words one hundred thousand times, binding and releasing as much as one can, according to one's desire.

analyzed: sakalām rātrim
translated: Then, at the end, throughout the entire night.

analyzed: kiñcid kālam muñcan
translated: Without resting, releasing for a short time.

analyzed: yathāvat ca bandhan japet
translated: And one should recite the mantra as much as possible.

analyzed: tatas mudrā jvalati āviśati uttiṣṭhati vācam muñcati iti
translated: Then the mudrā will blaze, enter, arise, or emit speech.

original: tato mudrābandhanenotpatati kāmarūpī bhavati antardhāti sarvakarmāṇi ca karoti /
analyzed: tatas mudrābandhanena utpatati kāmarūpī bhavati antardhāti sarva karmāṇi ca karoti
translated: Then by binding the mudrā one will fly, become one of desire, disappear, and perform all actions.

original: sarvamudrāśca bandhamātrā yathāvatsarvakarmāṇi kurvantī tyāha bhagavānvajradharaḥ //
analyzed: sarva mudrāḥ ca bandha mātrāḥ yathāvat sarva karmāṇi kurvanti iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: And all mudrās, merely by being bound, will perform all actions as desired. Thus has spoken the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: atha samādhayo iṣyet tena sūkṣmavajrādārabdhavya samādhimabhirocet taṃ hṛdayayogato'bhyaset /
analyzed: atha samādhayaḥ iṣyet tena sūkṣma vajrāt ārabdhavya samādhim abhirocet tam hṛdaya yogataḥ bhyaset
translated: If one wishes for the samādhis, one should begin with the subtle vajra, and if one delights in the samādhi, one should practice it with the yoga of the heart.

analyzed: tāvat yāvat catur māsam
translated: For as long as four months.

analyzed: sakalām rātrim paryaṅka avikṣapta samāpannena tiṣṭhet
translated: Then at the end, one should stand for the entire night, seated in meditation.

analyzed: tatas prabhāte sarva tathāgata ādyāḥ sarva siddhayaḥ āmukhībhavanti
translated: Then at dawn, all accomplishments beginning with all the tathāgatas will manifest.

original: tato yādṛśī abhirucistādṛśīmavāpnotī tyāha bhagavān vajrasatvaḥ //
analyzed: tatas yādṛśī abhiruciḥ tādṛśīm avāpnoti iti āha bhagavān vajra satvaḥ
translated: Then one will attain whatever one desires. Thus has spoken the Blessed One, Vajrasattva.

analyzed: atha karma sādhanam bhavati
translated: Now, the method of accomplishing actions is as follows.

analyzed: tathā eva japan māsam ekam sādhayet
translated: Reciting in the same way, one should practice for one month.

analyzed: sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then at the end, one should recite for the entire night.

original: tataḥ sarvakarmāṇi sidhyantī tyāha bhagavān vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: tatas sarva karmāṇi sidhyanti iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: Then all activities are accomplished, said the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

analyzed: atha karmāṇi bhavanti
translated: Now, the activities are as follows.

analyzed: sakṛt uccāritena ātma para grāma nagara rakṣa bhavati
translated: By reciting it once, one protects oneself, others, villages, and cities.

analyzed: kavaca bandha ādinā āveśam api kṛtvā candana gandhena graha agraha spṛṣṭa vajra aṅku śaśara hasta ratna sūrya dhvaja danta paṅkti padma khaḍga cakra jivhā sarva vajra kavaca daṃṣṭrā muṣṭi mudrā ādini sarva bhāvān āviśayati sakṛt japtena
translated: Having performed the armoring and so forth, by the scent of sandalwood, one enters all beings, such as the planets, the afflicted, the vajra hook, the arrow, the hand, the jewel, the sun, the banner, the row of teeth, the lotus, the sword, the discus, the tongue, all vajra armors, the fist mudra, and so on, by reciting it once.

original: māyākarma ca mayūrapatrapiñcchake vajraṃ cidhvā bandhayet /
analyzed: māyā karma ca mayūra patra piñcchake vajram cidhvā bandhayet
translated: And the illusory activity - having placed the vajra in the peacock feather, one should bind it.

original: tatastaṃ mayūrāṅgapiñcchakaṃ satvavajri mudrayā badhyāt tāvajjapedyāvat sarvatathāgatamudrā āviśati /
analyzed: tatas tam mayūra aṅga piñcchakam satva vajri mudrayā badhyāt tāvat japet yāvat sarva tathāgata mudrā āviśati
translated: Then, having bound that peacock feather with the sattva-vajra-mudra, one should recite it as long as all the tathagata-mudras enter.

original: tataśca piñcchakān nānādyāni rūpāṇi paśyati /🔽tataḥ prabhṛti tena piñcchakena sarvarūpāṇi vidhivad darśayati /
analyzed: tatas ca piñcchakāt nānā ādyāni rūpāṇi paśyati  tatas prabhṛti tena piñcchakena sarva rūpāṇi vidhivat darśayati
translated: Then, from the feather, one sees various forms.🔽From then on, with that feather, one displays all forms according to the rules.

original: tenaiva piñcchakena sakṛjjapte bhrāmitenātmanaḥ sarvarūpāṇi darśayati /
analyzed: tena eva piñcchakena sakṛt japte bhrāmitena ātmanaḥ sarva rūpāṇi darśayati
translated: With that very feather, by reciting it once and whirling it, one displays all one's own forms.

analyzed: tena eva piñcchakena laukikāni māyā karmāṇi darśayati
translated: With that very tuft, he displays worldly magical arts.

analyzed: buddha bodhisatva bimbāni api darśayati
translated: He also displays the images of Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: daśasu dikṣu sarvabuddhakṣetreṣu tathāgatāḥ saparṣanmaṇḍalāḥ samārasenādharṣaṇādibuddharddhivikurvitāni kurvanto darśayati /
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu sarva buddhakṣetreṣu tathāgatāḥ sa parṣad maṇḍalāḥ sa māra senā dharṣaṇa ādi buddha ṛddhi vikurvitāni kurvantaḥ darśayati
translated: In the ten directions, in all the Buddha-fields, the Tathagatas, together with the assembly of disciples, display the miracles and transformations of the Buddha, such as the shaking [of the earth], and so forth.

original: yāvatsarvākāravaropetaṃ buddharūpamātmānaṃ bhavatī ti //🔽vaśīkaraṇaṃ kartukāmaḥ sarvatathāgatasatvamudrāṃ badhvā tāvajjaped yāvatsā mudrāṃ jvalati /
analyzed: yāvat sarva ākāra vara upetam buddha rūpam ātmānam bhavati ti  vaśīkaraṇam kartu kāmaḥ sarva tathāgata satva mudrām badhvā tāvat japet yāvat sā mudrām jvalati
translated: Up to: one's own body becomes the form of the Buddha endowed with all the supreme aspects.🔽One who wishes to perform subjugation, having formed the mudra of all Tathagatas, should recite [the mantra] as long as that mudra blazes.

analyzed: tatas prabhṛti mudrābandhena sarva tathāgatān abhyārāgayati vaśīkaroti
translated: From that time onward, by forming the mudra, one delights and subjugates all Tathagatas.

analyzed: kim punar anyām satvān
translated: What need is there to mention other beings?

original: atha laukikottamasiddhayaḥ sādhayitukāmena tenādita eva tathaiva japatā māsamekamaṣṭasāhasrikeṇa japtavyaḥ /
analyzed: atha laukika uttama siddhayaḥ sādhayitu kāmena tena āditas eva tathā eva japatā māsam ekam aṣṭa sāhasrikeṇa japtavyaḥ
translated: Now, if one wishes to accomplish the worldly supreme attainments, then from the very beginning, reciting in the same way, one should recite for one month with the eight thousand [mantras].

original: tato'nte mudrāṃ badhvā tathaiva sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: mudrām badhvā tathā eva sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, at the end, having formed the mudra, one should recite the entire night in the same way,

analyzed: yāvat mudrā jvalati
translated: until the mudra blazes.

original: tataḥ prabhṛti mudrābandhena laukikasiddhividyādharasiddhīnāmekataro bhavatī tyāha bhagavāṃ vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: tatas prabhṛti mudrābandhena laukika siddhi vidyādhara siddhīnām ekataraḥ bhavati iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: From that time onwards, one will be one of the worldly accomplishments, the Vidyadhara accomplishments, by the binding of the mudra, said the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

analyzed: tathāgata kula upacāra vidhi vistaraḥ parisamāptaḥ
translated: The extensive ritual procedure of the worship of the Tathagata family is complete.

analyzed: atha vajrakula upacāra vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now, the extensive ritual procedure of the worship of the Vajra family is as follows.

analyzed: tatra āditas eva pūrvam evam kuryāt
translated: There, one should first do it in the same way as before.

analyzed: tathā eva yathākāma karaṇīya tayā
translated: In the same way, according to one's desire.

analyzed: akṣara lakṣam japet
translated: One should recite the syllable one hundred thousand times.

analyzed: asya sakalām rātrim japet
translated: One should recite this throughout the night.

original: tataḥ prabhṛti sarvasatvanigrahānugrahakṣamo bhavatī tyāha bhagavāṃ vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: tatas prabhṛti sarva satva nigraha anugraha kṣamaḥ bhavati ti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: From that time onwards, one will be able to control and favor all beings, said the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

analyzed: atha sādhayitum icchet tena yathāvat paṭam citrāpayitavyaḥ
translated: Now, if one wishes to accomplish it, one should have a painting done as usual.

original: tatastathaiva pūjāṃ kṛtvā māsamekaṃ sarvakāmabhojī yathākāmakaraṇīyatayā /
analyzed: tatas tathā eva pūjām kṛtvā māsam ekam sarva kāma bhojī yathā kāma karaṇīya tayā
translated: Then, having made the same worship, for one month, eating whatever one desires, according to one's desire,

analyzed: aṣṭasāhasrikeṇa jāpena catur sandhya vajra vācā japet
translated: one should recite the Vajra Speech at the four junctions, with a recitation of eight thousand times.

original: tāvadyāvanmāsānte paṭasyodārāṃ pūjāṃ kṛtvā vajrahuṃkāramahāmudrāṃ badhvā tāvajjapedyāvattasmāt mudrāṃ bandhāt /
analyzed: tāvat yāvat māsa ante paṭasya udārām pūjām kṛtvā vajra huṃkāra mahāmudrām badhvā tāvat japet yāvat tasmāt mudrām bandhāt
translated: Until the end of the month, having made a great worship of the painting, having bound the great Vajra Humkara mudra, one should recite it as long as from that binding of the mudra,

analyzed: huṃkāra śabdaḥ viniḥsṛtaḥ
translated: A humkara sound emerges.

original: tataḥ prabhāte maheśvarādayo devādhipatayaḥ sagaṇaparivārāḥ puraḥsthitvājñāṃ mārgayanti /
analyzed: tatas prabhāte maheśvara ādayaḥ devādhipatayaḥ sa gaṇa parivārāḥ puras sthitvā ājñām mārgayanti
translated: Then at dawn, the lords of gods such as Mahesvara and others, surrounded by their retinues, stand in front and seek instructions.

original: tato vidyādhareṇaivaṃ vaktavyaṃ yadāhaṃ brūyāmāgacchatedaṃ kuruta tadā bhavadbhirāgatya mamājñā kāryeti /
analyzed: tatas vidyādhareṇa evam vaktavyam yadā aham brūyām āgacchata idam kuruta tadā bhavadbhiḥ āgatya mama ājñā kāryā iti
translated: Then the Vidyadhara should say, When I say 'come', do this. Then you should come and carry out my command.

analyzed: tatas prabhṛti sakala tri loka adhipatiḥ bhavati
translated: From then on, he becomes the lord of the entire three worlds.

original: yathecchayā ca muhūrtamātreṇa sakalaṃ tribhuvanamājñāpayan bhramati /
analyzed: yathā icchayā ca muhūrta mātreṇa sakalam tribhuvanam ājñāpayan bhramati
translated: And as he wishes, in just a moment, commanding the entire three worlds, he wanders.

analyzed: punar api eti ca
translated: And he returns again.

analyzed: nigraha anugraham kurvam
translated: Performing restraint and favor.

analyzed: divyāni ca triloka bhogāni ca upabhuñjan yathākāma karaṇīya tayā
translated: Enjoying the divine pleasures of the three worlds, acting as he desires.

analyzed: sarva sura adhipati yoṣitā ādyāḥ sarva yoṣitaḥ ārāgayitvā upabhuñjati
translated: Having captivated all the women, including the chief women of all the gods, he enjoys them.

original: na ca tasya kaścit kiṃcicchaknoti kartuṃ /
analyzed: na ca tasya kaścid kiṃcid śaknoti kartum
translated: And no one is able to do anything to him.

original: huṃkāreṇa ca sarvaduṣṭadevādīn pramarditvā tatastāvatkalpaśatasahasrān jīvatī tyāha bhagavān vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: huṃkāreṇa ca sarva duṣṭa deva ādīn pramarditvā tatas tāvat kalpa śata sahasrān jīvatī ti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: And by the humkara sound, having crushed all the wicked gods and others, he lives for that many hundreds of thousands of kalpas. Thus says the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: atha mudrāsādhanamicched yathāvajjapaṃ kṛtvā māsānte vajrahuṃkārasamayamudrāṃ badhvā sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: atha mudrā sādhanam icchet yathāvat japam kṛtvā māsa ante vajra huṃkāra samaya mudrām badhvā sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, if one wishes to accomplish the mudras, having recited as before, at the end of the month one should bind the Vajra Humkara Samaya Mudra and recite throughout the night.

analyzed: tatas prabhāte mudrāḥ siddhāḥ bhavanti
translated: Then, at dawn, the mudras will be accomplished.

original: tato yathāvan mudrābandhena huṃkāraprayuktena ākāśagamanaviśvasaṃdarśanāntardhānamāyāsandarśanasarvāveśanākarṣaṇavaśīkaraṇasarvatuṣṭisaṃjananasarvaratnābhiharaṇamahātejojvālāsandarśanaratnavṛṣṭisandarśanamahāṭṭahāsapramuñcanasarvasatvasaṃśodhanacchindanabhindanaṛtucakraparivartanayathāvattatvollāpanasarvakarmapravartanarakṣajaṃbhanastaṃbhanatrāsanamāraṇasarvasatvamudraṇakāmaratikriyāpravartanābhiṣekasarvabhāvagāyāpananṛtyāpanāhvāyanapraveśanasphoṭanāveśanādīni sarvakarmāṇi karotī tyāha bhagavān vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: tatas yathāvat mudrābandhena huṃkāra prayuktena ākāśa gamana viśva saṃdarśana antardhāna māyā sandarśana sarva āveśana ākarṣaṇa vaśīkaraṇa sarva tuṣṭi saṃjanana sarva ratna abhiharaṇa mahā tejaḥ jvālā sandarśana ratna vṛṣṭi sandarśana mahā aṭṭahāsa pramuñcana sarva satva saṃśodhana chindana bhindana ṛtu cakra parivartana yathāvat tatva ullāpana sarva karma pravartana rakṣa jaṃbhana staṃbhana trāsana māraṇa sarva satva mudraṇa kāma r
translated: Then, with the proper binding of the mudras, employing the Hum sound, one can perform all activities such as flying in the sky, manifesting all things, becoming invisible, manifesting illusions, captivating all, summoning, enthralling, generating all pleasures, stealing all jewels, manifesting the great blazing splendor, manifesting a rain of jewels, emitting a great loud laughter, purifying all beings, cutting, piercing, reversing the wheel of seasons, evoking the truth as it is, engaging in all activities, protecting, paralyzing, stunning, terrifying, killing, sealing all beings, engaging in the activities of love and pleasure, anointing, causing all beings to sing and dance, summoning, entering, exploding, captivating, and so forth. The Blessed One Vajradhara has said this.

original: atha sūkṣmajñānasādhanamicchet tena vajrahuṃkārasamādhimabhyasatā tathaiva jāpayogena māsaṃ sādhayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: atha sūkṣmajñāna sādhanam icchet tena vajra huṃkāra samādhim abhyasatā tathā eva jāpa yogena māsam sādhayitavyam
translated: Then, if one wishes to accomplish the means of subtle knowledge, one should practice the Vajra Humkara samadhi in the same way, by the yoga of recitation, for one month.

analyzed: nena eva samādhinā sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, at the end, one should recite with this very samadhi throughout the night.

original: tāvad yāvat prabhāte pañcābhijñā bhūtvā sarvasatvānugrahanigrahakṣamo bhavatī tyāha bhagavān vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: tāvat yāvat prabhāte pañca abhijñāḥ bhūtvā sarva satva anugraha nigraha kṣamaḥ bhavati ti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: The Blessed One, Vajradhara, says that one will become one who has the five higher knowledges and is able to favor and restrain all beings, until dawn.

original: atha karmasādhanamicchet tena tathaiva japatā māsamekaṃ sādhayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: atha karma sādhanam icchet tena tathā eva japatā māsam ekam sādhayitavyam
translated: Then, if one wishes for the means of action, one should practice for one month, reciting in the same way.

analyzed: sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, at the end, one should recite throughout the night.

original: tataḥ sarvakarmāṇi sidhyantī tyāha bhagavān vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: tatas sarva karmāṇi sidhyanti iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: Then, the Blessed One, Vajradhara, says that all actions will be accomplished.

original: tataḥ karmāṇi bhavanti sakṛduccāritena manīṣitayā rakṣādīni sarvakarmāṇi karoti //
analyzed: tatas karmāṇi bhavanti sakṛt uccāritena manīṣitayā rakṣā ādīni sarva karmāṇi karoti
translated: Then, the actions are as follows: By uttering it once, with the wish, one performs all actions such as protection.
The extensive ritual of the means of accomplishment of the Vajra family is complete.

analyzed: atha padmakula upacāra vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now, the extensive ritual of the means of accomplishment of the Lotus family is as follows.

analyzed: tatra āditas eva tāvat śata sahasram japet
translated: First of all, one should recite one hundred thousand times.

analyzed: pūrvam eva akṛtā bhavati tatas sādhanam bhavati
translated: One should do it before, and then the means of accomplishment is as follows.

original: paṭe bhagavān sarvajagadvinayādyāḥ kartavyāstasya sarvapārśveṣu caturmaṇḍalayogena mahāsatvacatuṣṭayaḥ kāryaḥ ante ca devyaḥ /
analyzed: paṭe bhagavān sarva jagat vinaya ādyāḥ kartavyāḥ tasya sarva pārśveṣu catur maṇḍala yogena mahāsatva catuṣṭayaḥ kāryaḥ ante ca devyaḥ
translated: On the cloth, the Blessed One and all the world-taming, etc., should be made, and on all sides of him, the four great beings should be made in the form of four circles. And at the end, the goddesses.

original: tataḥ sa eva jāpavidhivistaro māsānte sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: tatas saḥ eva jāpa vidhi vistaraḥ māsa ante sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, at the end of the month, he should recite the extensive ritual of recitation all night long.

analyzed: tatas sarva jagat vinayaḥ bhagavān āgacchati
translated: Then the Blessed One, the world-tamer, comes.

original: yathākālaṃ vareṇābhipracārayatī ti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: yathākālam vareṇa abhipracārayati iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: As is proper, he bestows boons, says the Blessed One, the Vajra-holder.

original: atha mudrāsādhanamicchet tena tathaiva padmavajrimudrābandhaṃ kṛtvā yathāvan mucyāṣṭasāhasrikeṇa jāpena catuḥsandhyaṃ japet /
analyzed: atha mudrā sādhanam icchet tena tathā eva padma vajri mudrā bandham kṛtvā yathāvat mucya aṣṭa sāhasrikeṇa jāpena catur sandhyam japet
translated: If one wishes for the accomplishment of the seal, then having made the binding of the Padma-Vajri seal just as before, one should release it as is proper and recite it eight thousand times in the four periods of the day.

analyzed: tatas sakalām rātrim mudrā bandhena japet
translated: Then one should recite it all night long with the binding of the seal.

analyzed: prabhāte siddhiḥ bhavati
translated: In the morning, accomplishment will occur.

original: tato mudrābandhena yathāvat sarvajagadvinayaṃ karotī tyāha bhagavānavalokiteśvaraḥ //
analyzed: tatas mudrā bandhena yathāvat sarva jagat vinayam karoti iti āha bhagavān avalokiteśvaraḥ
translated: Then, with the binding of the seal, one can tame the entire world as is proper, says the Blessed One, Avalokiteśvara.

original: atha samādhinayasādhanamamicchet tena tathaiva māsānte sakalāṃ rātriṃ yathābhirucitena samādhinā jāpo dātavyaḥ /
analyzed: atha tena tathā eva māsa ante sakalām rātrim yathā abhirucitena samādhinā jāpaḥ dātavyaḥ
translated: If one wishes for the accomplishment of the method of concentration, then just as before, at the end of the month, one should recite it all night long with the concentration that is pleasing to oneself.

original: tataḥ prabhāte sarvasamādhaya āmukhībhavantītyāha bhagavān vajradharmaḥ //
analyzed: tatas prabhāte sarva samādhayaḥ āmukhībhavanti iti āha bhagavān vajradharmaḥ
translated: Then, at dawn, all the samādhis manifest. Thus says the Blessed One, Vajradharma.

original: atha karmasādhanamicchet tathaiva japanmāsānte sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: atha karma sādhanam icchet tathā eva japan māsa ante sakalām rātrim japet
translated: If one wishes for the accomplishment of activities, while reciting in the same way, one should recite throughout the entire night at the end of the month.

original: tataḥ sarvakarmakṣayo bhavatī tyāha bhagavāṃ vajradharaḥ //
analyzed: tatas sarva karma kṣayaḥ bhavati iti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: Then all activities will be exhausted. Thus says the Blessed One, Vajradhara.
The extensive ritual procedure for the worship of the Lotus Family is complete.

analyzed: atha maṇi kula upacāra vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now, the extensive ritual procedure for the worship of the Jewel Family is as follows.

original: tatrādita eva sarvatathāgatapraṇāmacatuṣṭayaṃ kṛtvā śatasahasraṃ japet /
analyzed: tatra āditas eva sarva tathāgata praṇāma catuṣṭayam kṛtvā śata sahasram japet
translated: There, having first paid homage to all the Tathāgatas four times, one should recite [the mantra] one hundred thousand times.

original: tatastathaiva paṭe bhagavāṃ sarvārthasiddhiṃ caturmudrāmaṇḍalayogena likhet /
analyzed: tatas tathā eva paṭe bhagavān sarva artha siddhim catur mudrā maṇḍala yogena likhet
translated: Then, on the same cloth, one should draw the Blessed One Sarvārthasiddhi in the form of the four-seal maṇḍala.

analyzed: tatas tathā eva pūjām kṛtvā tathā eva sādhayet
translated: Then, having made the same offerings, one should practice in the same way.

analyzed: māsa ante sakalām rātrim japet
translated: At the end of the month, one should recite throughout the entire night.

original: tataḥ prabhāte bhagavāṃ sarvatathāgatābhiṣekaratnaḥ ākāśagarbho bodhisatva āgatyābhiṣekaṃ dadāti /
analyzed: tatas prabhāte bhagavām sarva tathāgata abhiṣeka ratnaḥ ākāśagarbhaḥ bodhisatvaḥ āgatya abhiṣekam dadāti
translated: Then, at dawn, the Blessed One Sarvatathāgatābhiṣeka-ratna, the Bodhisattva Ākāśagarbha, having come, bestows the consecration.

original: tenābhiṣekeṇa trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau vidyādharacakravartī bhavatī tyāha bhagavān vajradharaḥ /
analyzed: tena abhiṣekeṇa tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau vidyādhara cakravartī bhavatī ti āha bhagavān vajradharaḥ
translated: By that consecration, one becomes a vidyādhara world emperor in the great trichiliocosm, says the Blessed One, Vajradhara.

original: atha mudrāsādhanamicchet tena tathaiva dharmavajriprayogeṇa vajraratnamudrā yathāvatsādhyā sarvāśākarmakarī bhavatī //
analyzed: atha mudrā sādhanam icchet tena tathā eva dharmavajri prayogeṇa vajraratna mudrā yathāvat sādhyā sarva āśā karma karī bhavatī
translated: Then, if one wishes to accomplish the mudrā, by that very method of Dharmavajra, the vajra jewel mudrā should be accomplished as it is, and it becomes the agent of all hopes.

original: atha maṇijñānamicchet sādhayituṃ tena tathaiva vajraratnodbhavasamādhiryathānukramato bhāvayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: atha maṇi jñānam icchet sādhayitum tena tathā eva vajra ratna udbhava samādhiḥ yathā anukramataḥ bhāvayitavyaḥ
translated: Then, if one wishes to accomplish the knowledge of the jewel, by that very method, the vajra jewel arising samādhi should be contemplated in sequence.

analyzed: niḥsvabhāvāt ākāśāt katham ratna saṃbhavaḥ iti
translated: How can a jewel arise from the essenceless space?

analyzed: ratnāt ca katham bodhisatva kāya saṃbhavaḥ iti
translated: And how can the body of a bodhisattva arise from the jewel?

analyzed: imam samādhim catuḥsaṃdhyam bhāvya japet
translated: This samādhi should be contemplated at the four junctures of the day.

original: yathopari tato māsānte tenaiva samādhinā sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: yathā upari tatas māsa ante tena eva samādhinā sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, at the end of the month, one should recite the entire night with that very samādhi.

original: tataḥ prabhāte sarvatathāgatairāgatya yathābhirucito'bhiṣicyata ityāha bhagavanākāśagarbhaḥ //
analyzed: tatas prabhāte sarva tathāgataiḥ āgatya yathā abhirucitaḥ abhiṣicyate iti āha bhagavan ākāśagarbhaḥ
translated: Then, at dawn, all the tathāgatas come and consecrate as desired, says the Blessed One, Ākāśagarbha.

original: atha kāmasādhana micchet tathaiva japatā māsānte sakalāṃ rātriṃ japet /
analyzed: atha kāma sādhanam icchet tathā eva japatā māsa ante sakalām rātrim japet
translated: Then, if one wishes to accomplish the desire, by that very recitation, at the end of the month, one should recite the entire night.

analyzed: tatas prabhāte bhagavān ākāśagarbhaḥ sarva artha sādhakaḥ bhavati iti
translated: Then, at dawn, the Blessed One Akashagarbha becomes the fulfiller of all aims.

analyzed: tatas sarva karmāṇi kuryāt iti āha bhagavān ārya vajradharaḥ
translated: Then one should perform all activities. Thus has spoken the Blessed One, the Noble Vajra Holder.

analyzed: maṇi kula upacāra vidhi vistaraḥ parisamāptaḥ  atha sarva kula upacāra sādhāraṇa vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: The extensive ritual of the jewel family's worship is complete.🔽Now follows the extensive ritual common to all families' worship.

analyzed: tatra āditas eva ca sarva hṛdaya upacāra vistaraḥ
translated: There, at the very beginning, is the extensive worship of all heart mantras.

original: hṛdayamanīṣitāni sarvatathāgatānāṃ sidhyantām ityuccārya hṛdayaṃ yathābhirucito japya sādhanavidhiḥ kartavya iti //
analyzed: hṛdaya manīṣitāni sarva tathāgatānām sidhyantām iti uccārya hṛdayam yathā abhirucitaḥ japya sādhana vidhiḥ kartavyaḥ iti
translated: May the heart desires of all Tathagatas be fulfilled. Having uttered this, one should recite the heart mantra as much as one desires, according to one's wish. The method of practice should be done.

analyzed: tatra ayam mudrā upacāra vidhiḥ
translated: There, this is the method of worshiping with mudras.

original: sarvamudrā me bhogyā bhavantī tyuktvā samayamudrāṃ badhvā yathābhirucito yathāśaktyā japet /
analyzed: sarva mudrā me bhogyā bhavantī ti uktvā samayamudrām badhvā yathā abhirucitaḥ yathāśaktyā japet
translated: May all mudras be enjoyed by me. Having said this, one should form the samaya mudra and recite as much as one desires, according to one's ability.

analyzed: tatas yathāvat siddhiḥ iti
translated: Then, the accomplishment is as it should be.

analyzed: tatra ayam sarva mantra upacāra vidhiḥ
translated: There, this is the method of worshiping all mantras.

analyzed: niḥprapañcā vāc siddhiḥ bhavatu
translated: May the accomplishment of non-elaborate speech be.

original: sarvatathāgatasamādhayo me ājāyantām ityuktvā mantraṃ yathābhirucito japet /
analyzed: sarva tathāgata samādhayaḥ me ājāyantām iti uktvā mantram yathā abhirucitaḥ japet
translated: May the samadhis of all Tathagatas arise in me. Having said this, one should recite the mantra as much as one desires, according to one's wish.

analyzed: eṣā siddhiḥ iti
translated: This is the accomplishment.

analyzed: tatra ayam vidyā upacāra vidhiḥ
translated: The method of the rite of knowledge is as follows.

original: avidyāndhā ca te me satvāḥ sarvatathāgatāśca vidyādhigamasaṃvarabhūtā ityuktvā vidyāṃ yathābhirucito japya sādhanamāvahed ityāha bhagavānāryavajradharaḥ
analyzed: avidyā andhā ca te me satvāḥ sarva tathāgatāḥ ca vidyā adhigama saṃvara bhūtāḥ iti uktvā vidyām yathā abhirucitaḥ japya sādhanam āvahet iti āha bhagavān ārya vajradharaḥ
translated: Having said, Those beings are blind with ignorance, and all the Tathāgatas are the ground of the vow of attaining knowledge, one should recite the knowledge as one wishes and accomplish the means of attainment. Thus says the Blessed Noble Vajra Holder.

analyzed: atha sarva hṛdaya mudrā mantra vidyānām yathākāma karaṇīya tayā vajra jāpa vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Then, for the sake of doing whatever one wishes with all the heart-mantra knowledge of the mudrās, there is the extensive rite of the vajra recitation.

original: yasya satvasya hṛnmudrāṃ mantraṃ vidyāṃ tu sādhayet /
analyzed: yasya sattvasya hṛd mudrām mantram vidyām tu sādhayet
translated: For whichever being one should accomplish the heart-mudrā, mantra, or knowledge,

original: jāpārthatastamātmānaṃ satvaṃ vā sādhya sidhyatītyāha bhagavān vajrasatvaḥ //
analyzed: jāpa arthataḥ tam ātmānam satvam vā sādhya sidhyati iti āha bhagavān vajra satvaḥ
translated: by the meaning of the recitation, that being or self is accomplished. Thus says the Blessed Vajra Being.

analyzed: sarva kula sādhāraṇa jāpa vidhi vistaraḥ parisamāptaḥ
translated: The extensive rite of the recitation common to all families is completed.

analyzed: atha sarva kula sādhāraṇa siddhi vidhi vistaraḥ bhavati
translated: Now, the extensive rite of accomplishment common to all families is as follows.

analyzed: tatra āditas eva tathāgata kula siddhayaḥ
translated: There, first of all, are the accomplishments of the Tathāgata family.

analyzed: tat yathārtha niṣpatti siddhiḥ ṛddhi siddhiḥ vidyādhara tvam mahā siddhiḥ ca iti
translated: They are: the accomplishment of the attainment of wealth, the accomplishment of spiritual powers, the state of a knowledge-holder, and the great accomplishment.

analyzed: tatra artha niṣpattiḥ bhavati
translated: Therein, the attainment of wealth occurs.

original: yatrā nidhiśaṅkā bhavet tatra mudrāṃ badhvā svasamādhinā tannidhisthānaṃ vajradṛṣṭyā nirīkṣayet /
analyzed: yatrā nidhi śaṅkā bhavet tatra mudrām badhvā sva samādhinā tad nidhi sthānam vajra dṛṣṭyā nirīkṣayet
translated: Where there is a suspicion of a treasure, one should bind the seal there with one’s own concentration and examine that place of treasure with the vajra gaze.

original: yadi vajrākāramuttiṣṭhatvaṃ paśyati tathā jñātavyaṃ nidhiratrāstīti /
analyzed: yadi vajra ākāram uttiṣṭha tvam paśyati tathā jñātavyam nidhiḥ atra asti iti
translated: If one sees it rising in the form of a vajra, one should know that a treasure exists there.

original: tato vajrasphoṭasamayamudrāṃ badhvotkhanya yathākāmakaraṇīyatayā gṛṇhīyādacirāt prāpnotī tyāha bhagavān vajrasatvaḥ //
analyzed: tatas vajrasphoṭa samaya mudrām badhvā utkhanya yathākāma karaṇīya tayā gṛṇhīyāt acirāt prāpnoti iti āha bhagavān vajra satvaḥ
translated: Then, having bound the seal of the samaya of the vajra-burst and dug it up, one should take it as one wishes. The Blessed One Vajrasattva says that one will soon obtain it.

analyzed: tatra ṛddhi siddhi niṣpattiḥ bhavati
translated: There, the accomplishment of magical power is perfected.

analyzed: yām mudrām sādhayet vajra siddhiḥ
translated: Whatever seal one accomplishes, it is a vajra accomplishment.

original: ityuktvā ṛddhisiddhiścaturvidhā bhavanti tadyathā jalasyoparicaṃkramaṇaniṣīdatādikaṃ tathāgatādisarvarūpasaṃdarśanaṃ yāvadabhirucistāvad adreṣyatvaṃ /
analyzed: iti uktvā ṛddhi siddhiḥ caturvidhā bhavanti tat yathā jalasya upari caṃkramaṇa niṣīda tā ādikam tathāgata ādi sarva rūpa saṃdarśanam yāvat abhiruciḥ tāvat a dreṣya tvam
translated: Having said this, the four kinds of magical power are: walking, sitting, and so on, on the surface of water; likewise, manifesting all forms such as the Tathagata, up to being unassailable as long as one desires;

analyzed: ākāśa gāmī ca yojana sahasram ūrdhvam utpatya adhastāt ca gacchati
translated: flying through the sky, rising up a thousand yojanas and going below;

analyzed: sarvādiśaḥ ca yojana sahasrāt yathā abhirucita vegaḥ paribhramya āgacchati
translated: and wandering in all directions as one wishes, up to a thousand yojanas, and returning;

analyzed: yojana sahasra ādarśena sarva satva manīṣitāni jñānāti
translated: knowing the desires of all beings up to a thousand yojanas away.

original: sarvabhāvāni ca cakṣuṣā paśyati śrotreṇa śṛṇoti /
analyzed: sarva bhāvāni ca cakṣuṣā paśyati śrotreṇa śṛṇoti
translated: And with the eyes he sees all forms, and with the ears he hears all sounds.

original: sarvadikṣu sa yojanasahasrādarśena mano'bhirucitāḥ sarvastriyo'ṅge samutkṣipyānayati /
analyzed: sarva dikṣu sa yojana sahasra ādarśena manobhiḥ ucitāḥ sarva striyaḥ uṅge samutkṣipya ānayati
translated: In all directions, with a mirror at a distance of one thousand yojanas, he attracts to his body all women who please the mind.

analyzed: sarva hiraṇya suvarṇa maṇi muktā ādayaḥ ca sarva arthān apaharati
translated: And he takes away all gold, jewels, pearls, and so forth, and all objects.

original: na cāsya kaścit kiṃcit chaknoti kartuṃ /
analyzed: na ca asya kaścid kiṃcid śaknoti kartum
translated: And no one is able to do anything to him.

analyzed: yat vajreṇa api adṛśyaḥ bhavati
translated: Even by means of a diamond, he becomes invisible.

analyzed: kim punar anyaiḥ
translated: What to speak of others?

original: daśapuruṣasahasrabalī nityārogyavān nityaṃ sarvakāmopabhojī sadāyauvano divyarūpī sarvatathāgatān savajrasatvāṃ paśyan pūjayaṃścānuttaravajrasiddhiścatvārivarṣasahasrāṇi jīvatī tyāha bhagavān sarvatathāgatavajraṛddhiḥ //🔽tatrāyaṃ vajravidyādharasiddhiniṣpattirbhavati /🔽mudrān sādhayaṃ vajravidyādhara iti kuryāt /
analyzed: daśa puruṣa sahasra balī nitya ārogyavān nityam sarva kāma upabhojī sadā yauvanaḥ divya rūpī sarva tathāgatān sa vajra satvām paśyan pūjayan ca anuttara vajra siddhiḥ catvāri varṣa sahasrāṇi jīvatī ti āha bhagavān sarva tathāgata vajra ṛddhiḥ  tatra ayam vajra vidyādhara siddhi niṣpattiḥ bhavati  mudrān sādhayam vajra vidyādharaḥ iti kuryāt
translated: Having the strength of ten thousand men, always healthy, always enjoying all desires, always youthful, with a divine form, seeing all Tathagatas and Vajrasattvas and worshipping them, he lives for four thousand years, attaining the unsurpassed Vajra accomplishment. Thus spoke the Blessed One, the Vajra Success of all Tathagatas.🔽There, this is the accomplishment of the Vajra Knowledge-Bearer attainment:🔽Having accomplished the mudras, one should become a Vajra Knowledge-Bearer.

analyzed: siddhayā vajra vidyādhara cakravartī bhavati
translated: By the accomplishment, one becomes a Vajra Knowledge-Bearer Chakravartin.

analyzed: sarva kāma upabhogī sahasra buddhakṣetram eka kṣaṇena paribhramya āgacchati
translated: Enjoying all desires, he travels in an instant through a thousand buddha-fields and returns.

analyzed: sarva sukhāni paribhuṃkte
translated: He enjoys all pleasures.

original: dviraṣṭavarṣavayuḥ ākuñcitakuṇḍalakeśadhārī mahāvajravidyādharaḥ sarvatathāgatān savajrasatvān paśyan mahākalpasthāyī bhavatī tyāha bhagavān sarvatathāgatavidyādharaḥ //
analyzed: dvis aṣṭa varṣa vayuḥ ākuñcita kuṇḍala keśa dhārī mahā vajra vidyādharaḥ sarva tathāgatān sa vajra satvān paśyan mahā kalpa sthāyī bhavati ti āha bhagavān sarva tathāgata vidyādharaḥ
translated: Having the appearance of a sixteen-year-old with curly hair, he becomes a great vajra vidyadhara, seeing all tathagatas and all vajra beings, and remains for a great eon. Thus says the Blessed One, the vidyadhara of all tathagatas.

analyzed: tatra mahā siddhi niṣpattiḥ bhavati
translated: There, the attainment of great accomplishment occurs.

analyzed: sva mudrām hṛdaya arthataḥ sādhayan
translated: Accomplishing one's own mudra with the meaning of the heart,

analyzed: sva mudrā sattva rūpī
translated: one's own mudra becomes the form of a being.

original: ekakṣaṇena daśasu dikṣu sarvalokadhātuṣu viśvarūpī viśvakriyāpravartakaḥ /
analyzed: eka kṣaṇena daśasu dikṣu sarva lokadhātuṣu viśva rūpī viśva kriyā pravartakaḥ
translated: In an instant, in all the world systems in the ten directions, having the form of the universe, engaging in all actions,

original: sarvatathāgatān savajrasatvāṃ dṛṣṭvā sarvākāravaropetābhiḥ sarvatathāgatapūjābhiḥ saṃpūjyāśeṣānavaśeṣasatvārthaṃ ca kṛtvā punarapyāyāti /
